While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mary Ann dreams for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA, toutes mariés ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames au quartier SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes wax, de condiments alimentaires, de légumes de savons à travers BINTOU S.. 
BINTOU S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt 12 cartons de savons au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma Group is composed of five married women, who on average are 37 years old and have five children. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their fourth group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. The women in this group sell wax pagnes (colorful African cloths), food condiments, vegetables and soap.

Mrs Bintou Sangaré intends to use her loan to buy 12 boxes of soap at the great market in Sikasso. She will retail her goods for cash at the Médine market in Sikasso to a clientele made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda B. is from the town of Trento. She is 52 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old while the youngest is only 7. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est constitué de 3 femmes mariées et d’une célibataire. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été payés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tubercules à travers MAMINATA TRAORE, la présidente du groupe.
MAMINATA TRAORE  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 600 kg de tubercules Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, souvent à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Djiguiya Group is composed of three married women and one single woman, who on average are 26 years old and have three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their fifth group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. The women in this group sell tubers. Mrs Maminata Traoré chairs the group.

Mrs Maminata Traoré intends to use her loan to buy 600 kilograms of tubers from wholesalers at the great market in Sikasso. She will retail her goods, often on credit or for cash, at the market in Sanoubougou and from her home to a clientele made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 80,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to provide for her family and repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers

loans.name: Elesio

texts.en:
Elesio M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 34 years old. Elesio is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 10. To make a living, Elesio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elesio has been engaged in his business for over 13 years.

Elesio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elesio is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, herbicides and fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elesio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, herbicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 54 years old. Esmeralda is married and has three children aged 18, 15 and 12. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. She works hard to provide the needs of her family, especially her children's education.

Esmeralda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Esmeralda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sanga Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANGA, (4 femmes toutes mariées), ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe à travers   AWA S.. 
AWA S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins et effectue sa vente en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et être réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the SANGA group are four married women who average 26 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. The previous loan was repaid without problems. This group of women trades firewood through AWA S..

AWA S. intends to use her loan to buy 10 cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies in the neighboring villages, and retails at her home to a clientele comprising mostly women, for cash and often on credit.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90) to be used in part to provide for her family's daily expenses, and to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy and resell firewood

loans.name: Jeanette Joy

texts.en:
Jeanette Joy M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old. Jeanette Joy is married and has three children aged 10, 8 and 2. To make a living, Jeanette Joy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jeanette Joy also grows hogs for fattening and sale.

Jeanette Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette Joy is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Tokouna Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TOKOUNA 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 35  ans, 5 enfants, vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames au quartier SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons sous plusieurs formes à travers KOROTOUMOU M.. 
KOROTOUMOU M., qui est la présidente du groupe,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  30 kg de poissons fumé auprès des grossistes au marché de Sikasso. Les poissons sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille  et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the Tokouna group, four married women with an average age of 35 and on average 5 children, mostly come from monogamous families from the neighborhood called Sanoubougou 1, a district of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the second time, so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their prior loan was reimbursed appropriately. 

This group of women sell fish in various forms, as does KOROTOUMOU M., the president of this group, who intends to use her share of the loan to buy 30 kg of smoked fish from wholesalers at the open-air market of Sikasso. The fish will be resold in the market of Sanoubougou 1 and in her family, to a clientele composed of men and women, retail, for credit or cash. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day family expenses and to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: buying smoked fish

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Jelyn is married and has three children aged 16, 9 and 2. To make a living, Jelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. She also maintains a small backyard piggery.

Jelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds, fertilizers and seeds. This will be the first loan taken out by Jelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.name: Jess

texts.en:
Jess G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 31 years old. Jess is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Jess owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jess works hard to build his business. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

Jess joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jess is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Jess from CEVI.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

texts.en:

Joan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. This will be the first loan taken out by Joan from CEVI.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 28 years old. Loida is married and has two children aged 9 and 6. Loida wants her children to finish college and she is working hard to achieve it.

Loida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Marlita

Marlita C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 44 years old. Marlita is married and has four children aged 20, 17, 12 and 3. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. loans.name: Ma. Junoise

texts.en:
Ma. Junoise J. is engaged in a fishing business. She also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various kinds of products. She does her best to sustain her sources of livelihood and be able to provide her family with an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PhP 15,000. This loan will help her buy fishing materials and additional merchandise to sell at her store. She believes that by investing in her business, she will be able to increase her income.

Ma. Junoise J. is 46 years old and a married woman.

loans.use: buy fishing materials and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ambenakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AMBENAKAN de l’association SINIGNESSIGUI est composé de 6 femmes mariées de la sous-préfecture de Kimparana, préfecture de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI). Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la  parenté et ont en moyenne 43 ans et en moyenne 9 enfants. 
Les membres de ce groupe ont intégré le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a 5 ans, elles sont à leur 9ème cycle. 
Elles évoluent dans les activités génératrices de revenus il y’ a environ 17 ans et font l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires, diverses marchandises et les  calebasses.
KOROTIMI M. compte  acheter,  35 colis de calebasses à San, Bla et les différentes foires  environnantes. Elles effectuent sa vente à  Kimparana et dans les autres foires environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle vend en espèce et à crédit. Elle espère réaliser mensuellement à un bénéfice de 29000 FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe compte sur un bénéfice de 24500 FCFA, qui serviront à rembourser les dettes, subvenir aux besoins familiales et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
The group named Ambenakan of the Sinignessigui association is composed of 6 married women who live in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana, prefecture of San, and Region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional families and they are known through neighbors, and through family. They are 43 years old on average and they each have 9 children. 

The members of this group joined the loan program at Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) five years ago and they are on their 9th loan cycle. 

They have had their revenue generating activity for about 17 years, involved in the buying and selling of condiments, various merchandise, and gourds. 

Korotimi M. plans on purchasing 35 packages of gourds at San, Bla and at the fairs in the area. They carry out their sales in Kimparana and at the fairs in the area to a clientele made up primarily of women. They sell in cash and credit. She expects to earn a monthly income of 29000 FCFA but the other members of the group expect a monthly income of 24500 FCFA. This income will be used to repay debts, to provide for her family’s needs and to reinvest in the business in order to increase it.

loans.use: To purchase gourds.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Djekadi est un groupe constitué de 4 femmes mariées de Kimparana, préfecture de  SAN région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI), qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la  parenté, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, 6 enfants et font le commerce de condiments, de céréales et  de calebasses. Les membres de ce groupe ont intégré le programme de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a 5 ans, elles sont à leur 9ème cycle. 
AFOU C. la vendeuse de céréales depuis plusieurs années   s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs dans les petits villages pour revendre en demi gros aux revendeurs qui viennent à la foire hebdomadaire de Kimparana. 
Elle achètera avec son prêt,  une tonne de petits mil, 0,5 tonnes de maïs  et 15 sacs de haricot. AFOU C. à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  Elle vend en espèce et à crédit. 
Elle compte avoir mensuellement à un bénéfice de 31000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser la dette, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
Djekadi is a group made up of four married women from Kimparana, in the SAN prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in large traditional families. They got acquainted through community ties and kinship, and average 39 years of age and six children. They sell food condiments, cereals, and calabashes. The members of this group joined the credit program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago, and are now seeking their ninth loan. 

AFOU C. has been selling cereals for several years, and gets her supplies from producers in small villages. She sells semi-wholesale to resellers who travel to the weekly fair in Kimparana.

With her loan, she will buy one ton of pearl millet, half a ton of corn, and 15 sacks of bean. AFOU C.'s clientele comprises both men and women. She sells for cash and on credit.

She intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 31'000 (ca US$ 62), that she will use to repay the loan, provide for her family's needs, and reinvest in her business to expand it.

loans.use: To buy and resell cereals

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sewa est composé de femmes mariées de Kimparana, préfecture de SAN région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI). Les membres du groupe Sewa vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la parenté, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 8 enfants. Les membres de ce groupe ont intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a 5 ans et sont à leur 10 eme  cycle. Elles évoluent dans les activités génératrices de revenus il y’ a environ 15 ans,  et excellent dans l’achat vente d’articles divers à partir de Lomé et Bamako.
SITAN T., fait l’achat et la vente des articles tels les condiments alimentaires, les pièces de tissus wax et bazins. 
Elle  envisage acheter, 12 cartons de cube maggi, 2 balles de wax real et hitarget, 20 complets de bazins. Elle est très sollicitée par ses clientes lors des foires hebdomadaires.    
Elle espère réaliser mensuellement à un bénéfice de 42000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser la dette, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
The Sewa group is made up of married women from Kimparana, a prefecture of the San region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The members of the Sewa group live with large extended families.  They have known each other as neighbors and fellow parents.  They are, on average, 41 years old, and have 8 children.  The members of this group have been part of the Soro Yiriwaso credit program for five years and are in their tenth cycle.  They have developed their businesses, generating revenues for approximately 15 years and they excel in buying and selling various items from Lomé and Bamako.

Sitan T. purchases and sells various items such as condiments, lengths of waxed fabric and damask.  

She intends to buy 12 boxes of maggi seasoning cubes, two spools of Real- and Hitarget-brand waxed fabric, and 20 damask outfits. She is highly sought out by clients during weekly fairs.  

She hopes to earn monthly profits of 42,000 FCFA which she will use to repay her debt, support her family's needs, and reinvest in the business so that it is able to grow.

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Bwizi Tukundane Balisa Group

texts.en: K. Gorreti is the leader of Bwizi Tukundane Balisa Group in Kyenjojo. She is 30 years old and married with 6 children ranging in age from 1 to 12. She has a retail shop in Bwizi trading center where she sells sodas, sugar, soap, grain flour, water, beans and so on. She has had her shop for over 2 years and her customers are mostly daily home use customers. She is able to make 40,000 UGX as weekly profits and she is grateful that she is also involved in agriculture and rentals. Her retail shop is a self-initiative and her prayer is to have a continuous stable family and business. She needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.use: Buying sodas, sugar, soap, grain flour, water and beans for increased stock.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 33 years old and a member of Kiserian Mugumo group.  She sells fruits, vegetables, and cereals in Kiserian open-air market.  She has been in the business for ten years.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she is able to save her money.  She has previously serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kes to buy fruits, vegetables and cereals such as rice.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and cereals such as rice for resale

loans.name: Lilian Wangui

texts.en:
For four years Lilian has been running a boutique in the Nairobi business center, where there is a flow of customers, and earns a profit margin of KES. 17,000 per month. She is 25 years old, married to Joseph, and they have one child.

Lilian was introduced to KADET by a friend and this is her fourth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying back the previous loans on time. She intends to buy ladies' clothes and children's clothes to sell.

She will save the extra profit and open another business. She hopes to be a prominent businesswoman within and outside the country.  Lilian is active and very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 32 years old and married with three children.  She runs a hardware shop to earn her living.  She has been running the business for ten years with one employee.  She joined Faulu Kenya six years ago.  She has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been able to send her children to school.  Currently, she is sending one of her children to high school.  She hopes to have a big business in the future. She has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kes to add to her stock of pipes, iron sheet, block board and plywood.

loans.use: To add to her stock of pipes, iron sheet, block board and plywood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes qui composent le groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  époux et enfants à Hèrèmakono, l’un  des quartiers centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois et des articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer pour la première fois au programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso 
Avec ce prêt  Hawa K., compte acheter, 5 sacs d’arachides auprès des paysans dans les villages environnants. 
La vente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit, au marché de Bougouni et à son domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt Hawa K. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée dans son entreprise et l’autre partie pour les frais de santé.
texts.en:
The women in the BENKADI group are all married, and average 32 years of age and three children. The live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in Hèrèmakono, one of the central neighborhoods in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through community and kinship bonds, and sell food condiments, charcoal, and various other items.

Eager to meet customer demand and bolster their business, they decided to join the credit program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso for the first time.

With this loan, Hawa K. intends to buy 5 sacks of peanuts from farmers in the neighboring villages. She retails for cash and on credit, at the Bougouni market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both women and men. 

Thanks to this loan, Hawa K. hopes to turn a monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used in part in her business, and in part for health expenses.

loans.use: To buy and resell peanuts

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI de l’association SIGUIDIA  est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Médine l’un des quartiers de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI font le commerce de volaille et de la friperie.
Dans l’espoir de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’accroitre, elles ont décidé de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui, elles sont à leur dixième prêt et tous les précédents furent soldés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Salimata T. qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 25 pintades et 40 poulets auprès des fournisseurs dans les villages environnants, pour ensuite faire sa vente au marché et à la maison en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composé de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt Salimata T. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour les frais de santé et de scolarisation des enfants et reste réinvesti dans activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group of the Siguidia Association is made up of married women who are on average 35 years old and have four children.  They live in nuclear families with their children and spouses.  These women live in Médine, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali).  They have known each other through kinship and as neighbors.  The women of the Benkadi group sell poultry and second-hand clothes.

Hoping to better satisfy their clientele, which is ever-expanding, they decided to seek support from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are seeking their tenth loan.  All their former loans were properly settled.

With this new loan, Salimata T., who is the president of the group, intends to buy 25 guinea hens and 40 chickens from suppliers in the surrounding villages, in order to then sell them individually in the market and from her home for cash and credit to a clientele made up of women and men.

With this loan, Salimata T. hopes to earn monthly profits of 20,000 FCFA which will be used toward health expenses and school fees for the children and the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Buying poultry

loans.name: Cherche Mari Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHERCHE MARI est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est constitué de 09 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elle ont constitué leur groupe de solidarité par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA EST.

Madame EUMEU D. debout à l'extrême de la photo, de tenue violet vêtue est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

Depuis un an elle fait un petit commerce d'encens. Son mari est tailleurs, EUMEU lui donne des tissus qu'il confectionne en suite elle vend le produit fini dans son quartier. 

Son crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de petit commerce afin de se procurer des bénéfices qui contribueront à la prise en charge de ses besoins. 

Son objectif est de constituer une épargne consistante au niveau du Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group CHERCHE MARI was created on December 14, 2008.  It is comprised of nine women who live in the same neighborhood. Their group was formed due to the neighborly and friendly relationships they share. The group is part of the Keur Serigne Louga Est Banc Villageois. 

Madame Eumeu D., standing on the far right in the purple outfit, is the group leader. She is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of two children.

For the past year she has been selling incense. Her husband is a tailor. Eumeu gives him fabric, which he turns into clothing and then she sells the finished products in the neighborhood.

Her loan will help her develop her incense selling business so that she can make more profits, which will contribute to her expenses.

Her goal is to consistently save money through her Banc Villageois.

loans.use: Developing a small-scale incense business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de six femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux  dans le quartier Hèrèmakono Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Deux d’entre elles font la restauration et les autres les commerces de Boissons non alcoolisées, de brochettes de viande, de céréales, des condiments alimentaires, etc.… 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de commerce pour élargir leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la deuxième fois dont le précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce  prêt Kadiatou S., compte acheter, une grande quantité de viande et des pains pour la préparation des brochettes, 7 cassiers de boisson BRAMALI et 10 paquets de boisons NBB. 
Elle s’approvisionne en viande auprès des bouchers au marché et en boissons au niveau des grossistes pour ensuite les revendre à la gare routière, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composé généralement d’étranger de passage.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé et le reste réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is comprised of six married women averaging 40 years of age and six children. The women live in nuclear families with their children and husbands in the Hèrèmakono Centre district of the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community.  Two of them have restaurants, and the others do business in softdrinks, meat kebabs, grains, condiments, etc....  

Concerned about having the capital for expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a second time. The past loans have all been properly repaid.  

With this loan, Ms. Kadiatou S. intends to buy: a large quantity of meat and bread for making kebabs; 7 cases of the beverage BRAMAL; and 10 packs of the beverage NBB.  

The group members get their supplies of meat from the butchers at the market and their supplies of beverages from wholesale merchants. Then they resell their goods, accepting cash in retail sales, to a customer base composed generally of traveling foreigners at the bus station.  

Ms. Kadiatou S. plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be go toward healthcare costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making kebabs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile-phone credit cards, soda, milk, sugar, sweets, and soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a member of Race-Course group in Faulu Kenya. He joined the group so as to access loans from Faulu Kenya easily. He runs a shop where he sells spare parts. He was previously working as a mechanic. He has been running his business for ten years and hopes to expand. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy starters, alternators, distributors, and winding.

loans.use: To buy starters, alternators, distributors, and winding

loans.name: Temirbek

texts.en:
Temirbek T. is a 41-year-old farmer. He has a very tight-knit family with four children of school age. In order to support his family, Temirbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Owing to his persistent, hardworking personality, Temirbek, with starting capital of 5000 KGS, managed to multiply his investments and now earns about 3000 KGS in a month at his farm with four cows, five goats and four horses. 
Temirbek plans to use the loan of 100000 KGS to expand his farm by buying four bull-calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to pay for the education of his children and broaden his business by purchasing more cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jackson Wamutu

texts.en:
Jackson Wamutu M., age 38, owns a retail shop as a primary business and also manages a green grocery shop in Mbotela estate. He is married to Anne, age 32, who is a farmer and contributes additional income for the family. They have three school-going children. 

Jackson has been in his business for five years with an income of 16,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. He was introduced to KADET by staff. He is applying for his fourth loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more stock for the shop, e.g., rice and sugar, and also to buy assorted vegetables for the green grocer shop. He plans to use the extra income to educate his children and expand the business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock like rice and sugar, and buy assorted vegetables

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a natural fruit-juice making stand for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her husband also helps cover the family's basic needs. The major challenge Mamuna faces in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Sop Aladji Madjib Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP ALADJI MADJIB est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont liées solidairement et habitent le même quartier. Elles ont une moyenne d'âge de 45 ans. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA EST

Madame Seynabou L. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo de grand boubou bleu vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'une nièce. (la fille à son jeune frère)

Elle fait de la broderie. Elle achète des tissus et des fournitures de broderie pour confectionner des draps de lits brodés. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter de la matière première pour mieux développer son activité. 

Son objectif est de créer un atelier de couture afin de faire l'extension de son activité. Elle participe aussi à l'amélioration de condition de vie de la famille
texts.en:
The SOP ALADJI MADJIB solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of eight women from the same neighborhood. They average 45 years of age. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Keur Serigne Louga Est.

Mrs. Seynabou L., seen standing at the far right of the photo and wearing a large blue robe, is the head of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of five children who are in her care. She is also looking after a niece (her younger brother’s daughter).

She makes a living doing embroidery. She buys fabrics and embroidery supplies to make embroidered bed sheets.

Her loan will allow her to buy the materials necessary to improve her activities.

Her goal is to open a sewing workshop in order to expand her business. She also works at improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and embroidery supplies

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is a married lady with five children. She owns and runs a green grocery. She has been in the business since 2000. She runs her business in Kawangware open-air market, and most of her customers are people of her locality. She hopes to expand her business so as to get more income. She is very thankful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to take her children to school. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy mangoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

Kenneth has operated an electronics shop for the past two years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Kenneth faces a major challenge of competition from other technicians in the area. He hopes to be self reliant in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase cables and switches for his electronics shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase cables and switches for his electronics shop

loans.name: Sansilao

texts.en: Sansilao is 41 years old, married and has 6 children. He runs a matatu (van) transport business.  He has been running his business for 10 years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business and hopes to buy more vans in five years. With 20,000 KES, he will buy tires and paint.

loans.use: To buy tires and paint

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El Señor Lino O. F. vive en concubinato y es padre de familia de dos hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, vive en concubinato  más de 4 años, se dedica a la producción de naranja y mandarina, ingreso que les sirve solo para sobrevivir y tener una vida estable, El cliente desea incursionar en una nueva actividad la de moto taxista la  cual mejorara su calidad de vida, esta actividad es una de las más solicitadas en el medio donde vive el cliente porque la gente se moviliza a su trabajo y domicilio en este medio de transporte por la rapidez y facilidad que cuenta este servicio que está a su alcance.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta.
texts.en:
Lino O. F. is in a live in relationship and is the father of two children whom he supports and helps with their schooling.  He’s been in this relationship for more four years.  He also raises oranges and mandarin oranges.   This provides only enough income with which to survive and maintain a stable life.

He would like to begin a new business venture, that of driving a moto-taxi.  This will help him to improve their quality of life.   This is one of the businesses in highest demand in the area where he lives because people use this mode of transport to travel between work and home, because of its speed, ease, and accessibility.

This will be his first loan, through our institution, which he will use to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: Moto-taxi

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man. He has one child who is still young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a M-pesa (mobile money transfer) service. He operates in a shop. His potential customers are market dealers and the neighboring community. Suleiman faces major challenges of not enough capital and a lot of competition in his business. He hopes to operate a big M-pesa (mobile money transfer) in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to pay for his M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business permit. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for his M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business permit

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is a mother of two children, aged between eighteen months and four years. Marie Rose’s husband works with her. Marie has a shop in which she sells beans, bananas, sugar and rice. Marie has done this business for ten years and this business has helped her build her own house. Marie is requesting for a loan in order to buy more beans, green bananas, sugar and rice for sale. With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to buy a piece of land. Currently Marie sells her goods on a retail scale but in the future she plans to start up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is married to a carpenter and they have three children, the youngest is ten while the eldest is fourteen years old. The children are all in school. 

Frida sells timber and she has done this business for ten years. Frida is requesting for a loan to buy more timber. She hopes to save her profits up to be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy more timbers to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a mother of one child who is three years old. She sells rice and sugar on a wholesale scale, while she sells other items such as salt and toothpaste on a retail scale. Claudine’s husband works with her and their business is going well. 

Claudine is requesting for a loan to buy more sacks of rice and sugar to make more profits. Since she bought a piece of land with the proceeds from this business, she hopes to start building a house as soon as she makes some more profits.

loans.use: Buying more rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a retail business for the past year, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Nassoro faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to sell by wholesale in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a Posho mill grinding machine from home. Her potential customers are the neighbouring community. In addition she also operates a retail shop which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell by wholesale in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to pay for her children's school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.fr: Goretti N. est commerçante.  Elle a 36 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et 4 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de pommes de terre, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, rembourser, et reprendre le crédit.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait construire une maison.
texts.en:
Goretti N. is a retailer. She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 4. She attended elementary school, and her children are currently in school.

She will use her loan to buy 15 sacks of potatoes, and also to employ workers. Her strategy for expansion is to save, and to repay and renew her loan. She would like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to re-sell

loans.name: Turdaly

texts.en:
Turdaly A. is 53, married and has four children. He lives in the town of Naryn, where he makes a living by breeding cattle. His wife earns a living by baking bread, but also helps her husband in his livestock business. Turdaly went into business in 1998 to earn a living and support his family. With initial capital of 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he worked hard to make his business successful. He was able to pay for the education of his daughters and today owns two cows, 15 sheep and one horse. 

Turdaly has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to expand his business by buying bull calves and sheep. With the revenues from his investment, he plans to rebuild his house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable people and is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that increase employment and help people meet the needs of customers and investors.

loans.use: to buy more more cows and sheep

loans.name: Samwel  Mwangi

texts.en: Samwel Mwangi G. is 37 years old and married to Mary Wanjiku, who is a businessperson. They have three children, all of whom are in school. Samwel runs his own business selling spare parts for cars in Ruai, an area which is urban and heavily populated. He has been in this business for five years and earns a profit of Kshs. 20,000 per month. He was introduced to KADET by friends and business associates, and is applying for his first loan to buy more spare parts to sell. He expects to earn additional profits, which he will use to continue expanding his business. His long-term goals are to build a large company and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more auto spare parts to resell to his customers

loans.name: Naira Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Naira Magdalena V. P. tiene 26 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en un Barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Naira es madre soltera de una hija, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hija. Naira se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo, pero tiene mejores ingresos por la venta  cosméticos. 

Naira quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hija , pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar un cierto monto de cosméticos porque le dijeron que los mismos subiran de precio, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito sera destinado para la compra de dichos cosmeticos para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Naira  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas mercaderia porque le esta yendo muy bien en ese negocio.
texts.en:
Naira Magdalena V. P. is 26 years old and lives in a rented home in Tarija.  Naria has a daughter and is a single mother.  Because of life’s circumstances, she’s had to work in order to get ahead with her daughter.  For the past seven years, she’s worked for a well known company, Crocan Pollo, selling fast food, broasted chicken.  She also earns a small income by selling cosmetics.

She would like to increase her income in order to get ahead with her daughter, and wants to buy a certain quantity of cosmetics because she was told that the price would be going up.  Since she already has some experience with financing.  She will use the money to buy said cosmetics so that she can increase her income.

Naria tells us that she would like to improve her living conditions, and so the next loan she requests will be for more merchandise, since things are going well for her in this business.

loans.use: Inventory (cosmetics)

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine has two children who are aged between one and three years old. Her elder child is in school while the young one hasn’t begun school yet. 

Clementine sells bread, cakes and donuts, on a wholesale basis; she has done this business for five years. Clementine is requesting this new loan in order to buy more cakes, bread and donuts. She plans to make as much savings from the profits as she can. This will possibly facilitate her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Buying more cakes, bread and donuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order  to eradicate poverty in her family and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase the raw materials for renovations including pipes, plaster, sinks and flooring

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael is a mother of one child who is 13 years. She is so hard working and she is focused. Rachael has a library and she is requesting for a loan in order to buy more books and to have a variety of books in her library. She has done this business for five years and this has enabled her to pay school fees for her child. With the profits, together with her savings, she hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Towards buying more books to sell.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 25-year-old woman from Israel's Negev region. After finishing high school, Amna worked at various jobs and then took daycare certification and management training. She has been working towards opening her own small daycare center for infants and toddlers. Recently Amna was certified by the municipality to become a sanctioned daycare with tuition paid by them. She owns a structure built by her family behind her home and is completing final renovations. 

Amna needs the loan to purchase cribs, toys, and supplies.

Amna planned the opening of her daycare well. In the future she wants to manage several classes and have staff to assist in the day-to-day care and activities. She sees this business as just the beginning and is dedicated to seeing it reach its full potential.

loans.use: purchase cribs, toys, and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an additional sewing machine and a special curtain eyelet-making (little holes) machine

loans.name: Sarifa

texts.en:
Sarifa is a 36-year-old mother of eight children. She has a successful traditional pita bread baking business which serves the area. Sarifa has gained a following as a talented cook with skills in baking. With her business Sarifa is able to pay for her children's school supplies and increase her family's monthly income.

Sarifa needs this loan to purchase supplies & equipment for making and baking pita breads, specifically firewood, bottled gas, and an additional 'taboon'  (outdoor pita stove).

For the next few years, Sarifa will expand her business from home and with the extra income she wants to ensure her children's education. Her dream is to open a full pita and bread store in the future and even expand into a bakery.

loans.use: purchase supplies & equipment for pita bread making

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est commerçante.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 8 enfants entre 8 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née à Congo (DRC), mais maintenant elle habite à Nyabugogo à Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 sacs de pommes de terre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et prendre beaucoup de prêts pour être indépendante chez elle.  Elle voudrait avoir un dépôt de pommes de terre, et aussi ajouter les bananes dans son commerce.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Pauline N. is an entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, a widow, and has eight children ranging from 8 to 23 years of age. She has primary education, and all her children study. She was born in Congo (DRC), but now she lives in Nyabugogo in Rwanda. She is going to use her loan to purchase 50 bags of potatoes. Her business strategy is to save money and to keep taking out loans in order to be financially independent. She would like to have a warehouse for potatoes, and also to add bananas to her business. For her family, she would like to buy

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes for resale

loans.name: Altynbek

texts.en:
Altynbek T. is 38 years old and makes a living as a farmer. He is also happily married and has three children. He is a graduate of the State Agricultural University and has worked as an agronomist. In order to generate more income for his family, he also went into business breeding cattle. Today he has a farm with 10 goats, 18 sheep, four horses and four cows, whose milk he sells to a local dairy farm. With the revenues he earns from his work, he was able to build a barn for his livestock.

Altynbek has applied for a loan of 35,000 KGS to expand his farm by buying eight sheep to fatten and resell. With the additional income made possible by this loan, he plans to continue expanding his business and eventually buy a car for his family to use. 
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to help especially vulnerable portions of the Kyrgyz population by extending microfinance loans. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of Kyrgyzstan through the delivery of services in rural and urban areas in a way that leads to increase employment and satisfied customers, clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand a livestock herd by buying eight sheep

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has eleven children and is already a grandmother. She owns a thriving mini-market which she runs with the help and support of her family. Fatma has had many challenges in her life, even losing one of her sons.  In the face of this tragedy, she and her husband grew together and are examples for many. Her family is strong and supportive, each striving for a better future.

Fatma needs this loan to upgrade the mini-market's refrigeration, expanding stock to include meat and other supplies.

In the future Fatma wants to further expand her mini-market and open up a 'shwarma' and 'falafel' stand for customers.

loans.use: upgrade her mini-market's refrigeration and expand stock

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery V. B. tiene  años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en Tarija. Rosmery es madre soltera de un hijo, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Rosmery se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rapida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo,  Rosmery quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hijo, pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprarse un horno industrial para poder vender pollo a la broaster, 
Como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicho horno que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Rosmery  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas maquinas industriales.
texts.en:
Rosmery V. B. lives in a rented home in Tarija.  She has a son and is a single mother. Because of life’s circumstances, she’s had to work in order to get ahead with her son.  For the past seven years, she’s worked for a well-known company, Crocan Pollo, selling fast food, broasted chicken.  Rosemary would like to have a better income in order to get ahead with her son, and she tells us that she would like to buy a commercial oven to be able to sell broasted chicken.

Since she already has some experience in this field, she will use the money to buy said oven which she needs in order to begin this venture.  Rosemary says that she would like to improve her living conditions, and so the next loan she requests will be for other commercial equipment.

loans.use: Commercial oven

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a fish selling business for the past six years, selling at the market to his neighbours. Iddi faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. He hopes to establish a seafood stall in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to pay school fees. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Elianne

texts.en:
Elianne was born in 1956. She has six children and the eldest is 33 years old while the youngest is 15 years old. Elianne sells charcoal on a wholesale basis. She has done this business since 1978.

Elianne finds her business very helpful because it has enabled her to meet her children’s needs for clothes and school fees. She is requesting for a loan in order to buy more sacks of charcoal. With the profits, she plans to purchase more charcoal to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma A. is married and has four children, two of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a coconut and mango selling business for the past 11 years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. With the 20,000 KHS loan, she wants to pay rent for her shop and purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay rent for her shop business and purchase sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Otoniel Antonio

texts.es:
Para  Otoniel  V., hombre de 55 años habitante de las Nieves de Barranquilla, barrio popular y carnavalero, la ornamentación ha sido el pan de cada día en su medio, porque conoce esta actividad hace 20 años  ya que es  de tradición familiar. Así fue como al quedarse sin empleo recurrió a lo que ha sido su máxima experiencia  “la ornamentación”, especializándose en    herrajes entre cerrojos y bisagras para puertas metálicas, portones, puertas de garaje y reja. Aunque  tiene entre sus maquinarias y equipos  soldador de punta, troqueles, maquinas de soldar, cisalla, prensa, congelador y herramientas varias, su meta principal es industrializar su actividad y generar empleos, pero la falta de capital es su gran desafío  y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a tramitar su Credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento y el cual invertirá en la adecuación de sus máquinas troqueladoras  con lo cual será mas eficiente ya que le ahorraría tiempo y dinero. 
Otoniel se muestra como un hombre disciplinado en su trabajo y cada día busca el perfeccionamiento de su saber empírico, por eso tiene muchos sueños con su empresa y sabe que los va a cumplir gracias a todos sus esfuerzos y al apoyo de las organizaciones que  en su gestión  le dan la mano, como la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y Kiva. Mientras tanto maneja los siguientes indicadores financieros:   Margen de Utilidad Bruta 89.19%,	margen de utilidad operativa 57.06%, margen de Utilidad Neta  47.06%, rentabilidad sobre las ventas  87%. En su negocio  Otoniel elabora y vende sus productos en ferreterías de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  tiene un empleado fijo, que trabajan por producción durante todo el año, en el sector, área de acción de su negocio no hay   competencia y por lo general venden sus productos sobre pedidos, Su fortaleza es que  cuenta con excelentes estados financieros , con un nivel de inversión bajo para la elaboración de sus productos , y su capacidad de pago es muy buena y suficiente para cubrir el valor de la cuota que le corresponde. Sus índices son muy buenos, con cero endeudamiento y una rentabilidad alta sobre el total de ventas y esto pronostica que su inversión sea exitosa al igual que su recuperación.
texts.en:
For 55 year old Otoniel V., resident of Nieves de Barranquilla, a popular carnival neighborhood, decorative gates and doors have been his daily bread.  He knows this business.  He’s been doing it for 20 years and it has become a family tradition.  He started doing what he knew best, “decorating,” when he became unemployed.  He specializes in fittings between locks and hinges for metal doors, gates, garage doors, and grilles.  Even though he has a variety of welding equipment and tools, his main goal is to industrialize his business and create jobs.  His great challenge is the lack of working capital, so he has seen fit to approach Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan.  This will be his first and he will invest the money in punching machines, which will make him more efficient, saving him time and money.

Otoniel has proven to be well disciplined in his work and seeks more knowledge each day.  This is why he has many dreams about his company, and he knows that he will fulfill them, thanks to his efforts and support from groups, such as Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva, who help him with management.  He maintains the following: Gross revenue 89.19%, operating margin 57.06%, net revenue 47.06%, and profits from sales 87%.

Otoniel makes and sells his products in hardware stores around the city of Barranquilla.  He has steady employees who work year round and there is no competition in the area where his business is located.  They manufacture most of their products to order.  His strength is that he has an excellent financial position and each product requires a low investment to produce.  His ability to pay is good and enough to cover his payments.  His indexes are very good and his high overall profits from his total sales lead us to believe that his investment will prove successful and he will recover it.

loans.use: Punching machines

loans.name: Angel Fabian

texts.es:
Desde muy niño  exactamente a la edad de 12 años, Ángel Fabian A. se ha dedicado a trabajar  y esto le generó tanta  madurez y disciplina que hoy tiene un negocio donde fabrica cerámica con 6 empleados fijos , tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y un hijo de 3 años de edad. El inició  comercializando la cerámica y para ampliar su espectro  decidió él mismo producirlo, comenzando con dos operarias de la persona que lo abastecía. Con su disciplina e inteligencia   ha demostrado que a pesar de ser muy joven es un gran trabajador con ganas de triunfar y hacer las cosas bien para salir adelante al lado de su familia.
El mercado de Ángel Fabian está ubicado en  los municipios del departamento del Atlántico, ciudades como Santa Marta en el departamento del Magdalena y Valledupar en el departamento del Cesar, donde comercializa  a través de 14 vendedores que van de puerta en puerta a y a los cuales el  vende al por mayor y a de contado, pero también tiene unos cuantos clientes a crédito, mientras  sus compras  de materias primas como barbutina, yeso pinturas,  son  semanal  y de contado. Sus principales   productos son espejos, cuadros, relojes y productos varios elaborado con la técnica de yeso envejecido. En la actualidad su capital neto de trabajo es de $3.015.000 Cop, su rotación de cuentas por cobrar  es de 5 días, tiene una rotación  de inventarios 19 días, mientras su rotación de cuentas por pagar es 3 días y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 18,9 %”.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su credikiva, el cual requiere para ampliar su capital de trabajo y poder provisionarse  con compras en mayor cantidad de materias primas  e insumos como pinturas, yeso, alambre, espejo, cinta y maquinas de reloj , con los cuales producirá hermosos  , cuadros,  relojes Consolas, floreros ,que ambientan con elegancia los espacios domésticos de las amas de casa, y también lugares los comerciales . 
Ángel Fabian A., tiene grandes sueños como joven emprendedor, como jefe de familia y miembro de una comunidad su principal meta es   tener una casa propia y que su negocio tenga una infraestructura moderna y muy elegante, aunque su gran desafío es lograr separar el espacio productivo de su vida familiar, porque en la actualidad  gran parte de la casa está ocupada por la fabrica y cada día se reduce mas su espacio doméstico.
texts.en:
Ángel Fabian A. has been working in this field since he was 12 years old.  Because of his discipline and maturity, he now has this ceramics business with six permanent employees.  He has a family, including a three year old son.  He started off by selling ceramic products, but later decided to broaden his horizons by producing them as well.  He's proven that, even though he's young, he is a hard worker with a desire to succeed and make things better for his family.

Ángel's markets are in the cities within the Atlántico department; cities such as Santa Maria, in the Magdalena department, and Valledupar, in the Cesar department.  There he sells through 14 salespersons that go door to door. He sells for cash but he also has a few customers to whom he extends credit.  He buys his raw materials, such as plaster and paint, weekly and in cash.  His main products are mirrors, frames, clocks, and various products made with the aged plaster technique.  His current net working capital is 3,015,000 COP, his revolving credit has a five day cycle, his stock rotates every 19 days, and his accounts payable cycle is three days.  His profit margin is 18.9%.

This will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva, which he needs in order to increase his working capital and buy supplies in quantity; supplies such as paint, plaster, wire, mirrors, and clock works.  With them he will make beautiful frames, clocks, consoles, and vases that will adorn living and commercial spaces.

Ángel Fabian A. has big dreams as a young entrepreneur, head of household, and member of the community.  His main goal is to have a home of his own, with a modern and elegant infrastructure.  His greatest challenge is to separate his work space from his family space because at the moment a large part of his home is dedicated to his work space.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Merlis Maria

texts.es:
Merlis Maria B. D. L. C.  tiene 30 años y vive en el barrio 7 D. Abril D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL., donD. es propietaria D.  una miscelánea y también venD. calzado y ropa. Merlis Es casada, tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 1, 2 y 4 años y sueña que ellos logren estudiar una profesión, se formen con calidad para que se conviertan en personas D. bien y exitosos. Merlis Maria con su madre desD. los 5 años D. edad, se residenció en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL., donD. cursó sus estudios D. bachiller y posteriormente terminó L. carrera D. análisis y programación D. computadores;  una vez casada se dedicó a vender mercancía variada, actividad que desarrollaba su madre, a L. que le puso un gran entusiasmo y con su organización ha logrado aumentar su capital, y ahora el  número D. clientes es superior  y L. diversidad permanentemente D. sus productos es notoria.
Este es el primer financiamiento que hace con L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con éste, su credikiva,  comprará calzado que es haga tengan éxito, porque se dispone a conquistar en cada momento un cliente para ampliar su negocio y es que su gran sueño  es ampliar su cobertura  en los diferentes sectores D. L. ciudad.  Mientras esto pasa su persistencia y empeño por surgir siguen adelante, hoy su capital D. trabajo es D. $2.685.700, maneja una  rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 11 días y D. cuentas por pagar D. 9 días, mientras L. rentabilidad sobre los activos es D. 17,53%.
texts.en:
Merlis Maria B. D. L. C. is 30 years old and lives in the "7th of April" neighborhood of the city of BarranquilL..  There she owns a shop where she sells shoes and clothing.  Merlis is married and has three children, ages 1, 2, and 4, and her dream is for them to study professional careers so that they can be very successful.  Merils Maris has been living in BarranquilL. since age five, where she studied and earned a bachelor's degree and later studied computer programming and systems analysis.  After she got married, she began selling clothing and other merchandise that her mother developed.  She put a lot of enthusiasm into this and has managed to increase her working capital.  Now she has many more customers and the diversity of her merchandise is well known.

This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva.  She will use the money to buy shoes that will help make her successful because she works at getting new customers and expanding her business every moment of the day and in every sector of the city.  At the same time she works on getting ahead.  Her working capital stands at 2.685.700 COP, she manages an accounts receivable cycle of 11 days, and an accounts payable cycle of nine days.  Her profit margin is 17.53%

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dermis Kellys

texts.es:
Dermis V. es una mujer de 58 años, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 29 años. Desde la edad de 15 años llegó a esta ciudad con mucha expectativa y buscando una mejor calidad de vida, así fue como estudió parte del bachillerato y luego trabajó en una empresa privada como operaria de confecciones, donde  estuvo por mas de 10 años y finalmente decidió independizarse  con ese conocimiento, emprendiendo su negocio   a la edad de 26 años cuando se casó y tuvo 4 hijos.  A medida que pasó el tiempo el negocio de confección creció y hoy es un taller dotado de maquinarias que funciona con dos operarias que  apoyan la producción. Este es el financiamiento Numero 15 que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización a la que   pertenece  desde hace  16 años, y con la que ha logrado de su mano mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio,  ampliarlo en clientes y adecuar las condiciones locativas del taller. Con este su credikiva   comprará materias primas como telas,  hilos, botones e insumos para elaborar uniformes para colegios. Su inversión sería exitosa porque tiene contratos con  tres colegios del sector para confeccionar sus uniformes de educación física y de a diario.
Su sueño aun consiste en continuar mejorando las  adecuaciones y tener una mayor producción generando más empleos a más operarias.  Este es su desafío y también el de  lograr la eficiencia y la calidad,  que amerita cada vez mas,  el mercado circundante al cual ella quiere llegar.  En la actualidad sus indicadores financieros son los siguientes:   rotación de  cuentas por cobrar   14 días, mientras los inventarios rotan cada 7, su rentabilidad sobre sus ventas de 30%,  su capacidad de pago actual de 68% y  su capacidad de pago futura con el crédito es de un 64%.
texts.en:
Dermis V. is a 58 year old woman who lives in Barranquilla. She is married with four children between the ages of 29 and 13. She arrived in the city at 15 years of age with high hopes of gaining a better quality of life. She studied part of her high school certificate before working for a private company where she made clothes for ten years. With the knowledge she gained throughout her time there, she finally decided to leave the company to start her own business at the age of 26, when she married and had four children. As time passed, her clothing business grew to be a workshop with two employees who operate the machinery.  

This is the fifteenth loan that Dermis has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has been part of this organisation for 16 years. With the help of this foundation she has been able to improve the infrastructure of her business, expand her client base and improve the conditions of the premises where her workshop is located. With this loan from Kiva, Dermis will purchase materials such as fabrics, thread, buttons and supplies to make school uniforms. This investment will be successful because she has contracts to make school uniforms and physical education uniforms for three schools in the area. 

Dermis' dream is to continue improving her premises and to increase her production with more employees and more machinery operators. This is a challenge for her, as is the goal of attaining the ever-increasing efficiency and quality which the market she wishes to tap into demands. Dermis' current financial indicators are as follows: turnover on accounts receivable is 14 days, while inventory turnover is 7 days. Sales profit is at 30%, her current ability to make payments is 68% and her future ability to make payments with the loan is at 64%.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as fabric, thread, buttons and supplies to make school uniforms

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 47 years old. She is a widow and has one child who is 29 years old. Donatha sells different foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes, cabbages, cassava and Irish potatoes. Donatha has done this business for 24 years and it has enabled her renovate her house and expand it as well. 

Donatha is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs, which she hopes will give her more profits. She plans to save her profits up to the point she can build a small house in which she could rear some chickens.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs
