loans.name: Viviana Esther

texts.es:
Barranquillera de nacimiento y con una hermosa hija de 9 años,   desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de mercancías como calzado, cosméticos, electrodomésticos juguetería, papelería y útiles escolares; tiene otra actividad que le genera otros ingresos en la prestación de servicios  de pedicure, manicure corte , siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y vive muy feliz por tener el negocio en su casa y no desatender a su pequeña hija , actualmente se capacita a través del Sena en la elaboración de calzado artesanal.
Su negocio llamado Miscelánea Emanuel, esta situado en el barrio Carrizal al sur  de Barranquilla en una vivienda  familiar que comparte con sus padres y su abuela; está dotado de una  buena infraestructura y adquirió   activos fijos, como vitrina estantería  y exhibidores de mercancías,  con sus ahorros de varios años, cumpliendo su  meta de lograr una buena presentación   y   esto fue con  mucho esfuerzo. Los clientes con los que cuenta  son personas naturales y vecinos del barrio carrizal y de sus  aledaños  en los cuales es bien conocida, porque Viviana  aprendió su actividad mercantil de una tía que la  enseñó e impulsó a seguir adelante, todo  con el propósito de  ayudar a su hija a darle un mejor futuro,  después de la separación de su esposo. 
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su credikiva,   el cual invertirá  en la compra al por mayor de calzado y obtendrá un 30% descuentos por la compra de  contado,  de esta manera  su margen  de utilidad aproximado seria de un 50%;  en la actualidad su promedio de ventas  en su  Miscelánea Emanuel  es de  $1.000.000 COP mensuales, con su crédito se incrementaran las ventas, por su nuevo capital   y por  ofrecer  un mejor servicio; también   invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares,  pues es usual que el primer trimestre del año   sea de gran  demanda de estos artículos.  Su inversión  seria exitosa   porque adicionalmente  tiene una clientela con un buen comportamiento de pago,   un proceso de selección, es muy positiva y creyente y además  ya tiene el  80% de la demanda  de estos productos resuelta  por su buena calidad.
Viviana V.  es una mujer soñadora y trabajadora, ella aspira a tener su propia casa y ubicar a su hija en un entorno para que tenga un futuro exitoso y un  taller de marroquinería generador de  empleo.
texts.en:
From Barranquilla by birth and with a beautiful 9 year old daughter, for the last year she has sold merchandise like footwear, cosmetics, home appliances, toys, paper goods and school supplies.  She has another income producing activity: providing pedicure, manicure and haircut services.  She has always enjoyed being independent and she lives very happy because her business is home based and she can watch over her daughter.  She is currently taking artisanal shoemaking courses through SENA (National Education Service).

Her business is called Miscelánea Emanuel (Emanuel Miscellany).  It is located in the Carrizal neighborhood in south Barranquilla in the family home she shares with her parents and grandmother.  It has good infrastructure and she acquired fixed assets, like glass shelving and merchandise display cases, using saving from several years back thereby meeting her goal of attaining good appearance; she managed this with much effort.

Her usual customers are residents of Carrizal and neighboring areas where she is well known because Viviana learned her mercantile skills from an aunt that taught her and urged her to continue forward with the goal in mind of helping her daughter have a better future after the separation from her husband.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and first Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy footwear at wholesale getting a 30% discount for paying cash.  This way her profit margin will be 50%.  Her current monthly average sales in Emanuel Miscellany are $1.000.000 COP.  With the loan sales will increase thanks to the new capital and thanks to being able to offer better service.  She will also invest in the purchase of school supplies because the first trimester of the school year is traditionally of high demand for these items.

Her investment will be successful because her clientele has good payment habits, a selection process, she’s very positive and a believer and besides, she already has 80% of the demand for these products resolved because of their good quality.

Viviana V. is a hard working woman with dreams.  She hopes to have a house of her own and to place her daughter in an environment leading to a successful future as well as a leatherworking workshop that will generate employment.

loans.use: To buy footwear and school supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Gulmayram

texts.en:
Gulmayram S.  is a 53-year-old farmer with four children. She and her husband Kanybek make a living by breeding livestock, and during 25 years of marriage have helped each other build their business. They have also provided a good example of a successful marriage to their children. 

Gulmayram grew up in a large family of farmers, and helped her family breed animals  when a child. Her wide experience in farming has benefited her own business, which she started in 1996 to generate an income for her family. Starting with capital worth 10,000 KGS, they have slowly expanded to a point where they have three milk cows and 15 sheep, and earn about 1,500 KGS a month by selling milk in the local market. 

Gulmayram is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more  livestock to fatten and resell. With the revenues made possible by this loan, she hopes to continue expanding her farm.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the most vulnerable population in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic by delivering microfinance loans in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and satisfied customers, clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli has been selling clothes in a shop for four years. She is a married woman with five children who attend school. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, Batuli wants to pay school fees for her child so as to enable the child to settle into school without having to be sent home often for fees. 

Batuli sells clothes on a retail basis to the villagers. She owns her home, which has electricity but no water. She cites school fees as her greatest expense. She hopes to someday open a wholesale sales location. She joined Yehu so as to access funds to run her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a leso business for the past one year, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby.  A leso, also known as kikoi, is a piece of colored cloth used as clothing and wrapped around the waist and legs or shoulders. Asia faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. She hopes to establish a boutique business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan she wants to purchase 40 lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: buying 40 lesos for resale

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin M. est célibataire, et  Il a une éducation primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter la farine pour préparer les baignés, et acheter les œufs, car son commerce est le détail de ce deux produits.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité et apres avoir travailler longtemps et ayant la capacité, il souhaite se marier.  Il voudrait acheter une vielle maison et la réhabiliter.
texts.en: Célestin M. is single. He has a primary education. He is going to use his loan in order to purchase flour to prepare beignets, and also eggs, since his line of business is retailing these two types of food products. His business strategy is to save money in order to expand his business and be able to get married. He would like to have a house and furnish it.

loans.use: Purchasing beignet flour and eggs for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Tienda la esquina de Juan Pablo es el negocio de Gloria Jiménez, ella es una mujer que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 10,  12 y  15 años.  Gloria vivió en Chigorodó en el Uraba Antioqueño  y desplazada en el año 1977 fue apoyada por Acción Social de la Presidencia de la Republica de Colombia,  quien le entregó a ella una vivienda de interés social y un pequeño capital de trabajo con el que inició un  negocio, que   unido con su experiencia   ha logrado convertir en  una tienda. 
Este es su sexto financiamiento que le hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización con la que ha logrado crecer desde que se vinculó a ella.  En la actualidad necesita comprar una ventana corrediza, víveres y abarrotes para la seguridad de su negocio y para surtirlo con lácteos, arroz, aceite, azúcar y granos, este es  justamente el motivo de su credikiva pues obtendria mas descuentos y ofrecería mejores precios a sus compradores .  
Su máximo sueño y  motivación que la impulsa al arduo trabajo diariamente,  es que sus hijos   se conviertan en profesionales exitosos y gente de bien  en el futuro, por eso su meta mas adelante  es  adecuar su negocio, lograr incrementar   su clientela y tenerlo surtido con lo que ellos  necesitan  para que le genere mayores utilidades y continuar creciendo con su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Jiménez runs a corner store in Juan Pablo. She lives in Cartagena with her husband and three children who are 15, 12 and 10 years of age. Gloria lived in Chigorodó in the coastal region of Antioquia until she was displaced in 1977. She was supported by Acción Social, an initiative of the Presidency of the Republic of Colombia, who provided her with publicly-subsidised housing and a small amount of working capital to start a business. With this capital and her experience, she was able to transform the business into a store. 

This is the sixth loan that Gloria has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her business has grown ever since she has been linked with this organisation. Currently, Gloria needs to purchase a sliding window, provisions and groceries to maintain her store and stock it with dairy products, rice, oil, sugar and grains. For this reason she is requesting a loan through Kiva so that she can obtain more discounts and offer better prices to her buyers.

Her greatest wish and the motivation behind her hard work is that in the future her children grow up to be successful professionals and good people. Her goal for the future is to stock up her store, increase her customer base and keep her store maintained with everything that her customers need to generate more profits so that she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase a sliding window, provisions and groceries to maintain her store and stock it with dairy products, rice, oil, sugar and grains

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi M. is single and has three children, two of whom attend school, while one graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past nine years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.  With the  20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 20 kilograms of rice and 20 litres of cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase 20 kilograms of rice and 20 litres of cooking oil

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Odette’s husband sells cattle and supports her in whatever she does. Odette has a shop in which she sells various home items such as soap, matches, and sugar. Odette has done this business for seven years and it has helped her to pay for her children’s school fees. Odette is requesting a new loan in order to expand her shop; she wants to buy other foodstuffs and items such as maize flour, bread, and juices. With the profits she plans buy more items and in the future she hopes to open up a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha has been selling selling food at a food stall near her home. She is a married woman with three children, two who attend school and one who is under age. With the Ksh. 10,000, Mwanasha wants to buy food stock which includes oil and wheat flour.

Her major customers for her business are the nearby community. She experiences the challenge of seasonality as most customers do not turn up during the rainy season. She owns her home, which has water but no electricity. She cites food as her major expense. She hopes to open a little restaurant in future. She joined Yehu so as to access funds to help her in her business so she can improve her living standards.

loans.use: Buy 20 litres of cooking oil and one bale of wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Emiliana

texts.es: La señorita María Emiliana G. G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de zapatos y sandalias tiene un puesto ubicado en la calle Independencia Ica su local es alquilado hace varios años. La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar le ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus padres, está solicitando el crédito para comprar mercadería para la campaña escolar , se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que tiene experiencia acrediticia con otro entidades bancarias la cual está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en: María Emiliana G. G. sells shoes and slippers from a rented location on Independencia Street.  She is single with no family obligations, but helps her parents with the family expenses.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy merchandise for the coming school year.  We propose granting her the loan because she has a good credit history and she has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: La Confianza Group

texts.es: Doña Ingrid Maritza  A. C. es madre soltera, ha cursado el primer  grado primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al comercio  venta de ropas tipica, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina la Confianza, El grupo cuenta con tres   integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar la crianza de animales. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería   y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en ASDIR.
texts.en:
Ingrid Maritza A. C. is the single mother of two children whom she cares for.  She completed the first year of junior high school and has been selling clothing for 15 years.  With lots of enthusiasm and with the help of some of her neighbors, they formed a group so that they can request a loan.

This united group is called “Confianza,” (Confidence) and is made up of three members; ladies who are dedicated to different businesses, including raising livestock.  They will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise so that they can increase their sales.  One of the challenges of being a business owner is the lack of working capital, but she has managed to get ahead with the help of her children, and she expects her business to be large and productive, with the help of this loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jidaini A

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Jidaini. He is married and has a one-year-old son. In 2008, Jidaini established his medical drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,680,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional medicine.

Jidaini hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 336,000. In the future, Jidaini plans to increase his business by buying even more drugs and building a bigger shop. Jidiani would also like to educate his son in the best possible way. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy additional drugs for resale

loans.name: San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Doña Sandra Yanina C. C.  es una persona casada, ha cursado el sexto grado primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al servicio venta D. refacciones, tiene 5 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo organiza un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina San Bartolo. El grupo cuenta con cuatro  integrantes mujeres, y un hombre  quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales, venta D. almuerzos, venta D. refacciones y servicio D. ruletero. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para invertirlo en capital para labor que realiza y así incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Ella ha ha salido adelante con la ayuda D. sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más granD. y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en ASDIR.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanina C. C. is married, has a sixth graD. education, and has two children whom she still supports.  She sells spare parts for wheeled vehicles and has been doing so for five years.  With great enthusiasm, she formed a group so that they could request a loan.  This united group is called San Bartolo and is maD. up of four women and one gentleman who are involved with different businesses.  Among those are raising livestock, selling lunches, and spare parts for wheeled vehicles.

She will use the money from this loan as working capital so that she can increase her sales.  She has managed to get ahead with the help of her children and expects her business to grow and become more productive with the help of this loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo vizcaíno un joven soñador  y trabajador, padre de 5 hijos en las edades de 10 hasta   menos de un año.  Se dedica  al lado de su cónyuge,  con quien ha logrado salir adelante,  al alquiler de lavadoras y a la venta de detergentes electrodomésticos y ropa  desde hace dos años. Él vive con su familia en Carrizal un barrio carnavalero por excelencia donde la fiesta  y la música compartida entre vecinos es casi su filosofía. En este ambiente se desenvuelve Rodolfo en sus actividades productivas que surgieron de su propia observación en su medio  y de su propia experiencia cuando compraba a crédito., sus clientes son personas naturales, vecinos del barrio, entre  amigos y familiares. Rodolfo se identifica a si mismo como una persona muy responsable y serio en sus obligaciones y acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para reemplazar a los presta diarios, que otorgan créditos a intereses onerosos y este es justamente su máximo desafío.  Su promedio de ventas mensuales es de $1.000.000 COP y su margen de utilidades es de 50% , con su credikiva comprará una lavadora porque tiene mucha demanda que no puede cubrir y con ella empezaría a responder parcialmente a nuevos clientes. Igualmente comprará mercancía variada de contado y en mayor cantidad. 
Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda para su familia y en el negocio seguir  ampliándolo con cada crédito que obtenga de parte de la Fundación  y especialmente con la inversión de sus utilidades que ofrecen estas inyecciones de capital de trabajo. Rodolfo está muy contento con el acceso a su credikiva,  porque   su desafío  era  encontrar la oportunidad de financiamiento en organizaciones y tener vida crediticia, y con su credikiva empieza  a construirla.
texts.en: Rodolfo V. is ambitious and hard-working.  He has 5 children, from one- to ten-years old.  He has worked along with his wife, with whom he has managed to build a successful business renting washing machines and selling washing soap and clothing, over the last two years.  He lives with his family in Carrizal, a neighborhood famous for its Carnivale celebration and for the music that is practically a way of life among the residents.  Rodolfo knows the neighborhood well and he's shaped his business to meet the needs that he sees.  He used to buy on credit himself so he identifies with his customers, normal people from the neighborhood who are often relatives and friends.  Rodolfo describes himself as responsible and serious.  He approached the Fundacion Mario Santo Domino for a low-cost loan to pay off another higher-interest loan.  His average monthly sales are COP$1,000,000 and his margin is 50%.  He will use this loan from Kiva to buy a washing machine so that he can meet growing demand for his washing machine rental business.  He will also pay cash for miscellaneous merchandise that he will buy in bulk.  Rodolfo's dream is to buy a house for his family.  He wants to continue expanding his business, something he can do with each new Fundacion loan.  Rodolfo is happy that he can borrow from Kiva because his greatest challenge before was finding funds to expand his business.  Once he establishes himself as a borrower with Kiva, he can start building a credit history.

loans.use: Buy a washing machine and other merchandise for rental business.

loans.name: Russie

texts.en:
Russie owns a little shop selling various consumable items. Russie is 40 years old, married, and has two children, aged four and eight. Both her children are enrolled in school. 

 Russie sells consumables such as sugar, maize flour, rice and many more, which she has been doing for two years. Her husband is a driver.  Russie will use the loan to increase the capacity of her business through adding new products to her inventory.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Russie plans to further upgrade her business to offer better services to her customers. She would like to have a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are fourteen and eighteen years old. Currently, both of her children attend school.  Enid sells snacks, which she has done for one and a half years. Her husband is a lecturer.  She has decided to request this loan to add more snacks to her business inventory.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Enid plans to reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a dairy because she has realized that it can generate more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy more snacks to sell

loans.name: Helen Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Helen Maria C. Fernández vive junto a su esposo e hijo. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Santiago. La Sra. Helen se dedica a la venta de comida hace 1 año. Tiene el negocio en la casa de sus padres. Vende diariamente caldo de gallina y pollo broster. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio de la zona. Su sueño de la Sra. Maria es incrementar su negocio y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agardecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travéz de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Sra. Helen Maria C. F. lives with her husband and son, in her parent's house, in the Peruvian town of Santiago.  Sra. Helen has operated a business selling food for 1 year.  She operates the business from her parent's house.  She sells roast chicken and chicken broth.  Her husband works for the municipal government.  Sra. Helen wants to expand her business and help her family gain a better quality of life.  She is grateful for the support that this kind of lending provides.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Juan Domingo

texts.es: Don Juan Domingo Hernández Hernández, es una persona casada, ha cursado el sexto grado primaria, tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, él  se dedica a la artesanía confección de pantalones de lona, tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de su esposa, para realizar este trabajo de confección lo  ayudan sus hijos para realizar esta actividad. El préstamo el lo utilizará para compra de una maquina industrial plana y así incrementar el volumen de producción. Una de las dificultades de ser, operario  ha sido la falta del capital de trabajo, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en: Don Juan Domingo Hernández Hernández has a sixth grade education.  He is married and has 8 children, all now grown.  He has operated a business making and selling denim trousers for 10 years.  He has the enthusiastic help and support of his wife and his children help him with the business.  He will use this loan to buy machinery so that he can increase his output.  One of the difficulties that he has faced as a business owner is access to working capital.  He has managed to make a success of the business with help from his children, but he wants to expand the business and make it more productive.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Yohnny

texts.es:
Yohnny vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Akerana. El señor se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y vende leche a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL;  también es enfermero auxiliar Es su principal fuente  de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene dos  hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio-económico indica qaue es sujeto de préstamo.
texts.en:
Yohnny lives in his own house in the small town of Akerana.  He operates a business raising dairy cattle and selling his output of milk to the local dairy producer, PIL.  He also works as an assistant nurse.  It's his main source of income. 
 
Yohnny will use this loan to buy a dairy cow to supplement his income.  
 
This is Yohnny's first Impro loan.  A socio-economic analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for the loan.

loans.use: Buy a milk cow for dairy business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona de Villa Adela de la Ciudad de El Alto. El señor se dedica al trasporte urbano y su esposa es tejedora; con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen e ingreso. No tienen hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la construcción de vivienda; ellos quieren ampliar su vivienda y para eso planean construir un par de habitaciones para vivir más cómodamente.
 
Es tercer crédito con IMPRO y su historial de pagos es intachable, es decir excelente.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in a house that he owns in the Villa Adela neighborhood of the Bolivian city of El Alto.  He works as a driver in the city and his wife makes and sells woven cloth.  They have no children and their income is enough to support them.

Oscar will use this loan to add two new rooms to his house.  The extra space will allow them to live more comfortably.
 
This is Oscar's third IMPRO loan and he has an excellent record of repaying past loans.

loans.use: Building costs for two rooms.

loans.name: Delmy Emely

texts.es:
Delmy, D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Osicala departamento D. Morazán, está casada vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 19, 12 y 7 años D. edad, administra un negocio, el cual lleva 12 años dedicándose a atender, ella venD. maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar y sal, trabaja a tiempo completo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería D. la que venD. en el negocio como aceite, frijoles, azúcar, sal, arroz, con este préstamo estará incrementando el inventario D. materiales, así también ofrecerá un mejor servicio a los clientes.
En cuanto al negocio Delmy aspira ampliarlo, ser la preferencia D. los clientes, en su familia quiere luchar trabajando arduamente para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro siendo profesionales
texts.en: Delmy, 38 years old, lives in the Osicala area of Morazán. She is married and lives with her husband and three sons aged 19,12 and 7 years. She has been running her own business for 12 years, working full time selling corn, beans, rice, sugar and salt. Today she is applying for a loan to purchase the type of goods that she sells in her business such as oil, beans, sugar, salt and rice. This loan will enable her to increase her stock as well as to offer an improved service to her clients. Delmy aims to expand her business, to be her clients' first choice and, with regards to her family, she wants to continue working hard so that her sons will have a better future as professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies such as oil, beans, sugar, salt and rice.

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es:
Don Hilario tiene 46 años de edad, reside en Arambala, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra y producción de hortalizas, él vive con esposa de 42 años de edad y tres hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años de edad, el señor Hilario se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como chile, pepino, ejotes, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el trabajo, este oficio lo aprendió de sus hermanos mayores.
Él necesita invertir un préstamo en semillas y pago de jornales para comenzar la siembra de hortalizas, son dos personas que le ayudan a desarrollar el trabajo en un área grande de terreno.
Su objetivo es aumentar el cultivo para que su producción sea mayor, también que sus hijos obtengan una mejor calidad de vida y accecen a una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Hilario is 46 years old.  He lives in Arambala, in Morazán department, with his 42 year-old wife and three children aged 18, 17 and 14.  Hilario grows vegetables such as chili peppers, cucumbers and green beans.  He has 4 years experience in this business which he learned from his older siblings.

Hilario needs a loan so that he can invest in buying seeds and paying laborers to start sowing his vegetables.  He has two people who help him in his work as he sows his crops over a large area of land.  His goal is to increase his crops and production.  He also wants to achieve a better quality of life for his children and for them to study at university.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay laborers

loans.name: Jose Filonilo

texts.es:
Don José Filonilo, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 13 y 12 años, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto, don Filonilo cuenta con 48 años de edad, su negocio consiste en la crianza de ganado de leche y de repasto, en pequeñas proporciones, lo aprendió de su padre y los atiende a tiempo completo, pero además se dedica a crianza de cerdos, gallinas ponedoras, siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto, esto contribuirá a aumentar el número de reces en su granja, también en un futuro tendrá la oportunidad  de obtener un mayor ingreso por comercializarla en el momento adecuado.
Su propósito es trabajar con mucha motivación para alcanzar estabilidad económica y dar a su familia lo más necesario, también que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
José Filonilo lives in Osicala, in Morazán department, with his wife and two children aged 13 and 12.  He is 48 years old and his business is raising both dairy and non-dairy cattle on a small scale.  He learned the business from his father and he works in this business full time.  However, he also raises pigs and laying hens, and sows corn, beans and sorghum.

José Filonio is requesting this loan to buy non-dairy cattle.  This will help increase the number of cattle on his farm and, in the future, he will have the opportunity to make more money by selling them at the right time.  His goal is to work with a lot of motivation in order to reach a certain level of financial stability, so that he can cover his family's basic needs.  He also wants his children to be able to study and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock to her restaurant

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a vender alimentos, como: desayuno, negocio que lo realiza de manera ambulante, siendo su lugar de venta frente a una universidad privada, que se encuentra cerca de su casa. En ocasiones su hija la apoya en la atención de su negocio, atendiendo a los clientes por las mañanas. Sus mayores ventas son a partir de abril hasta diciembre, temporada de clases. Sin embargo cuando llega el tiempo de vacaciones, ella ve más ventajoso realizar otro negocio, de esa manera no deja de percibir ganancias, es por ello que teje para luego vender dichas prendas. Sabina considera muy importante cualquier comercio que se proponga, pero ahora desea intensificarse en su negocio de alimentos y ampliarlo. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de maca e ingredientes al por mayor para seguir vendiendo desayunos y con otra parte en la compra de lana de diferentes colores.
texts.en:
Sabina is 43 years old. She lives with her three children in her own house. For more than six months she has been selling food, in particular, breakfasts, as an ambulatory vendor. Her sales spot is in front of a private university that is near her house. Sometimes her daughter helps her tend her business, waiting on customers in the mornings. Her best sales are from April to December, when classes are in session. Nevertheless, when the vacation period comes, she finds it advantageous to work at another business; in this way she doesn't stop earning income. So she knits articles of clothing to sell later.

Sabina considers any business that she proposes to be very important, but now she wants to intensify and increase her food business. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always shown that she is responsible in her payments. In addition, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people who very united. She is thankful to the people who will be grantors of the loan that she is seeking, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of maca (an Andean root vegetable) and other wholesale ingredients to continue selling breakfasts, and with another part of the loan she will buy wool of different colors.

loans.use: Buy ingredients (oats and maca) that she needs to prepare breakfasts; also buy wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock to his business.

loans.name: Erika Idalia

texts.es:
Erika, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, ella vive con su familia su hija, su madre y hermanas, se dedica a vender minutas en las afueras del centro escolar de la colonia Santa Barbará, perteneciente a San Carlos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las minutas, los cuales son jaleas de diferentes sabores, hielo, leche condensada, vasos y cucharas, este préstamo le dará estabilidad para contar con material suficiente para continuar en su trabajo, ya que de este negocio es que mantiene a su hija y ayuda a su familia para los gastos.
Sueña con crecer a su hija con todo lo necesario, además de trabajar para que ella pueda estudiar y superarse teniendo mejores oportunidades de superación.
texts.en: Erika is 25 years old and lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department, with her daughter, her mother and her sisters.  She sells light meals outside a school in Santa Barbará neighborhood, in San Carlos and is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her meals.  She will buy different flavored jellos, ice, condensed milk, glasses and spoons.  This loan will give her stability as she will have the supplies she needs to continue in her work.  Through her business, Erika supports her daughter and helps cover her family's expenses.  She dreams of her daughter growing up with everything she needs and she also plans to work so that her daughter can study and improve herself by having better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy different flavored jellos, ice, condensed milk, glasses and spoons

loans.name: Abass J.

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Abass J. K.. He is married and has two children, ages four and eight. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they help in his business. 

In 2001, Abass established his assorted foods business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-employed. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Abass J. plans to open another shop, further his education, educate his children and build a house. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to his business.

loans.name: Jose Isrrael

texts.es:
José Israel, un señor trabajador de 45 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia compuesta por sus hijos Israel de 15 años, Ana de 13, Nelson de 10, Rudis de 8 años de edad, y su esposa Doña Virginia, ellos se dedican a la fabricación de productos de loza, de esta actividad dependen todos es por eso que todos colaboran para hacer comales, ollas, este negocio don Israel lo aprendió desde pequeño y lo ha venido perfeccionando en el transcurso de los años, hoy en día este negocio es el que le ayuda a solventar  las necesidades del hogar; esta familia es unida, se comparten el trabajo realizándolo todas las mañanas, su desventaja es que en ocasiones se queda sin capital para seguir fabricando, este motivo le ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales como leña, losa cruda y nacazcol.
Estos materiales le serán de mucha ayuda, ya que tratara de comprar lo suficiente para un buen tiempo, esto le permitirá continuar trabajando con su familia, y realizar las ventas de los productos y obtener ingresos,  ya que son varios los integrantes de esta familia, por lo que es necesario tener estabilidad en los ingresos económicos.
Sueña con poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando, además tener lo suficiente en alimentación para mantener a su familia, también tener oportunidad de crecer como artesano dándose a conocer en otros mercados.
texts.en:
José Israel is a hard-working, 45 year-old man who lives in Guatajiagua, in Morazán department.  Israel lives with his wife Virginia and his children: 15 year-old Israel, 13 year-old Ana, 10 year-old Nelson and 8 year-old Rudis.  He and his wife work making products from clay.  The whole family depends on this business and, for that reason, they all help in making the pots and 'comales' (special dishes for cooking tortillas).  Israel learned this business when he was young and has been perfecting his skills over the years.  His business now helps him to cover his household expenses.

This is a very close family.  They all help in the business every morning.  The problem they have is that sometimes they don't have enough capital to continue making their products.  This is why Israel is requesting a loan, so that he can buy materials such as firewood, clay and 'nacazcol' (a dye).  These materials will be very helpful to him.  He will try to buy as much material as he needs to last a good period of time.  This will allow him to continue working with his family, selling his products and making income which he needs because he has a lot of family members which means that he needs to have some financial stability.

Israel dreams of being able to help his children continue with their studies and of having enough food to support his family.  He also dreams of having the opportunity to grow as an craftsman and become known in other markets.

loans.use: To buy materials such as firewood, clay and nacazcol (a dye)

loans.name: Dieu Devant Saintesuzanne Group

texts.fr:
Irma est la coordinatrice de son groupe Dieu-Devant Saintesuzanne 1 & 2.

Elle est mariée et elle a 4 enfants. Irma habite dans la région Sainte-Suzanne d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Irma a dirigé son commerce de produits alimentaires pendant les 23 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Irma était couturière. Irma voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à tels produits comme du riz, de la sucre, de l’huile et du poids.

Irma espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à gagner beaucoup d’argent pour faire progresser le commerce et avoir une boutique.

Des autres membres Dieu-Devant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du gaz et autres.

Irma  dit que son défi principal est une manque de travail au sein de la communauté ce qui signifie que  les gens qui veulent acheter sur le marche n’ont pas de l’argent.  

Irma  dit que son but principal c’est de gagner beaucoup de l’argent pour faire l’ éducation de ses enfants. Son rêve c’est d’ouvrir une grande boutique a l’avenir.
texts.en:
Irma is the coordinator for her group called "Dieu-Devant Saintesuzanne" 1 & 2. (God First, Saint Suzanne). She is married and has four children. Irma lives in the Sainte-Suzanne region of Haiti where electricity is rare and the water supply is very limited. 

Irma has managed her business selling grocery items for 23 years. Before opening her food stall, Irma was a seamstress. She would like to use this loan to invest in such products as rice, sugar, oil, and peas. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn a lot of money so she can make the business grow and have a shop.

The other members of the 'Dieu-Devant" group need a loan for business ventures such as selling charcoal, bottled gas, etc. 

Irma  says that her main challenge is that members of her community are jobless and so when they want to buy something in the shops, they don't have any money. She says her main goal is to earn a lot of money so that she can educate her children. Her dream is to open up a big shop in future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and peas for her little food stall

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María Santos, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos, ellos estudian.
María se dedica a la venta de alimentos como pupusas, yuca, papitas fritas, desde hace tres años, ubicándose en el centro escolar donde vende de 7:00am a 5:00pm, también los domingos sale a vender a la cancha de futbol, este negocio le provee lo necesario para dar a sus hijos la alimentación que necesitan.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en una nueva actividad económica como lo es la crianza de cerdos ya que de esta actividad se obtienen ingresos al momento de vender los cerdos, también quiere comprar mercadería de la que utiliza para preparar las ventas. Este préstamo le ayudara a atender un nuevo negocio y a mantener al mismo tiempo sus ventas.
El objetivo de María es seguir trabajando cada día por sus hijos, para que no les falte lo necesario y puedan estudiar y superarse.
texts.en:
María Santos is 37 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children who are studying.  María has been selling food such as pupusas, cassava and French fries for three years.   She sells her products from 7.00am to 5.00pm in a local school.  She also goes out to sell her products at a soccer field on Sundays.  This business allows her to put food on the table for her children.

María is currently requesting a loan to invest in a new business activity: raising pigs, as the income from this business comes at the moment the pigs are sold.  She would also like to buy the supplies that she needs to prepare her food.  This loan will help her to set up her new business and, at the same time, keep her current business running.

María's goal is to continue working every day for her children, so that their basic needs are covered and so that they can study and improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy pigs and merchandise

loans.name: Ya Aminata

texts.en:
This is 49 year-old Ya Aminata K.. She is married and has 4 children, ages 6, 9, 15 and 18. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she helps to educate them. 

In 2007, Ya Aminata established her palm oil business because she wanted to help her husband finance the education of their children. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to add stock, to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. In the future, Ya Aminata plans to sell in larger quantities to traders in town and in the capital, Freetown. She wants to travel, to sell internationally in order to earn more profit and she would also like to hire workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Lenlabh

texts.fr: Madame Lenlabh  a 39 ans et est mariée avec  un enfant en charge. Elle est couturière  de profession mais elle a associé la vente de  pagnes  pour pouvoir participer au menage.  Elle a commencé son activité en 2000 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite  ces marchandises à côté de la station agbalépédo. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir de nouveaux lots de pagnes et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Ms. Lenlabh, aged 39, is married and has one child to support. She is a dressmaker by profession, but she has included with it the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), in order to help out at home. She started her business in 2000 and gets her supplies at the big market of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She then resells her merchandise next to the Agbalépédo station. She is requesting a loan for acquiring new batches of pagne cloth and satisfying more customers.

loans.use: Buying traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre y de sus hermanos. Desde hace  4 años decidió  emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, en un inicio alquiló un local dentro de una calle comercial, ahí sufrió un percance, en el que le robaron todas sus cosa. Ante esto tuvo que establecer su negocio en casa de sus padres. Desde entonces se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de llamadas a celular, para ello cuenta con un control de tarifa casero que tiene  dentro de sus cabinas de locutorio. Además este negocio lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y algunos artículos de bazar como regalos y detalles para el arreglo personal, de esta manera su  negocio este más surtido, atractivo para su clientela. Afirma que le gusta trabajar de manera independiente porque puede disponer de su dinero y es por esta razón que esta planeando  adquirir mejores equipos pasa su negocio. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más tiempo de linea libre para realizar llamadas en su locutorio; asimismo en la compra de golosinas y bebidas gasificadas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Pilar is 24 years old, and lives in her parents’ home, along with her mother and siblings.  Four years ago she decided to set up her own source of income, and rented premises on a commercial street.  There, she had a mishap, in that everything was stolen.  Because of this, she had to establish her business at her parents’ home.  Since that time, she has offered cell-phone service, and for this has a rate-control device in the phone booths.  She supplements this business with the sale of sweets and other general items, such as gifts and personal-care products.  Thus, her business offers greater variety, which is attractive to customers.  She states that she likes to work independently, because she can handle her own funds, and thus she is planning to purchase better equipment for her business.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is pleased to be part of a communal bank, because all of the members are reliable and responsible.  She thanks all those who will manage the loan she is requesting, because it will be very useful in growing her business.  She will use the funds requested to buy more free line time to make calls in the phone booth, as well as to purchase sweets and soft drinks to offer her customers.

loans.use: To purchase free minutes for calling, as well as sweets.

loans.name: Kokouvi Petit

texts.fr: Monsieur  Petit a 26 ans et est mécanicien de profession pour assuré ces besoins. Mais il a associé la conduite de  taxi  moto à Lomé et les zones environnantes. Il a débuté cette activité en 2007. Il est né à Lomé et habite quartier adidogomé. Il demande un crédit pour acheter  une nouvelle moto sanya.
texts.en:
Mr. Petit is 26 years old. He was born in Lomé and now lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He is a mechanic by trade and supports himself through this activity. He also offers a motorcycle taxi service in Lomé and surrounding areas. He started this secondary activity in 2007. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase a new Sanya motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Alcira Enoe

texts.es: Alcira Enoe tiene 46 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 estudia, ella le brinda mucha atención y apoyo a su familia siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Ella es una mujer muy responsable, inicio con su Mama quien le había enseñado este medio de vida ya que con cierta experiencia logro obtener su propio negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos y detergentes.
texts.en: Alcira Enoe is 46 years old and works in a local store which she opened more than twenty years ago. She has two children, only one of whom is in school. She provides her family with a lot of care and support. Alcira Enoe always pays careful attention to her customers' needs. She is a very responsible woman. Her mother got her started in this line of work and after Alcira Enoe gained a certain amount of experience, she was able to open her own store. She is requesting this funding in order to buy candy, soda, basic grains, and detergent.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for store

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es:
Ademar Borbón U., tiene la edad de 22 años, esta soltero. El quiere comprar una motocicleta para su trasporte al trabajo. Con ésta compra él se está facilitando su trasporte al trabajo y así llegar a tiempo a laborar, el tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta y en mantenimiento para tenerla en buenas condiciones para su buen desempeño. Piensa en el futuro y en su estabilidad  laboral por lo cual quiso adquirir este vehículo para ser puntual a la hora de llegada a su trabajo.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ademar Borbón U. is a 22-year-old single man. He would like to buy a motorcycle to use to commute to work. This would make his commute easier and allow him to arrive on time for work. He has a lot of experience with motorcycles and knows how to keep them in good working condition. Ademar has been thinking about the future and about having stable employment. This is why he has been thinking about getting a motorcycle, which would allow him to arrive on time to work. This is the first loan he will have received from FUDECOSUR. He has never received other loans from state banks before. FUDECOSUR has made it easier for him to receive the loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia 
es casada con Pedro, Ella trabaja todos los dias en vender ponchos y costuras, para cama tiene tres hijos aun estan en epoca escolar, Ana patricia solicita este credito para comprar sueteres,ponchos,playeras,ya que en esta epoca son muy vendibles las chamarras por el frio,es asi como se gana la vida trabajando fuerte para poder sobrevivir, ella sueña con tener su propio local para ´poder tener un almacen conforme al tiempo.
texts.en: Ana Patricia is married to Pedro. She works every day selling clothing and bed coverings. She has three children who are still of school age. Ana Patricia is applying for this loan to buy sweaters, ponchos, and beach shoes, since they are in demand at this time; she sells sheepskin jackets for the cold. This is how she earns a living, working hard to be able to survive. She dreams of having  her own shop and being able to stock it according to the season.

loans.use: Buy sheepskin jackets, sweaters, beach shoes, and bed coverings.

loans.name: Palo Herrado Group

texts.es:
el grupo Palo Herrado esta ubicado en la aldea palo herrado, lo integran 3 mujeres, muy amigas y con muchas ganas de superarse, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas relizan:
 
la joven Maria Teresa R. se dedica a la venta de comidas y golosinas, le vende sus comidas a mucho personal del SANAA (empresa gubernamental) y a Radio Paz, por la ubicación de estas empresas que estan cerca a su negocio estas personas visitan a diario su local. 
Maria se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para estar muy temprano en su local y asi satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tortillas, refrescos, agua, jugos, vegetales, frijoles, arroz, embutidos etc.
 
la joven Cecilia O. se dedica a prestar los servicios de moler maiz, les brinda el servicio a la mayoria de personas de la aldea en donde vive ya que es el unico molino que se encuentra en su comunidad , todos los 
dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para cubrir con la demanda de las personas que necesitan de dicho servicio, Cecilia trabaja muy fuerte ya que su madre depende de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para el molino.

la señora Santos A. es una mujer honrada y respònsable, que se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, su producto lo distribuye en su misma aldea donde vive, la demanda es bien grande y esto hace que su negocio tenga buenos ingresos, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para empezar la produccion de tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal, agua.
texts.en:
The Palo Herrado group is located in the village of Palo Herrado.  The group has three female members who are good friends and have a great desire to improve themselves.  Their business activities are as follows:
 
Young Maria Teresa R. sells meals and candies.  She sells her meals to a large number of workers at SANAA (a government-run company) and Radio Paz.  As these companies are close to her business, these people visit her premises every day.  Maria gets up at 4 in the morning so that she can be in her business very early and meet her customers' needs.  She will use her loan to buy beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, soft drinks, water, juice, vegetables, beans, rice, sausages etc.

Young Cecilia O. offers corn grinding services to most of the people in her village since she owns the only mill in her community.  Every day, she gets up at 5 in the morning to meet the needs of the people who require her service.  Cecilia works very hard since her mother depends on her.  She will use her loan to buy spare parts for her mill.

Santos A. is a decent and responsible woman who makes and sells tortillas.  She distributes her products to people in her village.  Demand for her products is very high and this means that her business makes good profits.  She gets up very early every day to start making her tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and water.

loans.use: To buy pork, beef, chicken, rice, beans, tortillas, water, juice, sausages, soft drinks, firewood, corn and lime.  To buy spare parts for a mill: bands, sandpaper and disks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia Verónica

texts.es: Sonia: tiene 26 años es soltera vive con su hermana gemela, sus padres ya fayecieron ella lucha con su hermana para salir adelante, sonia cuenta con la venta de ropa, tipica como sueteres y cortes tipicos, y en temporadas venden frutas y verduras, en el mercado de su comunidad, el sueño de Sonia es mejorar su calidad de vida, por eso solicita este credito para aumentar su capital y su ganancia, y asi poder salr adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Sonia, aged 26, is single and lives with her twin sister. Their parents already passed away. Sonia, along with her sister, struggles to get ahead. She sells typical clothing, such as sweaters and other traditional dresses. In addition, during the season she sells fruits and vegetables at the market in her community. Sonia's dream is to improve her quality of life. Therefore she applied for this loan to increase her working capital and income, and thus progress with her family.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Maria Teresa Albertina

texts.es: Maria Teresa Albertina: tiene 64 años. es casada tiene un hijo, ella de dedica a la elavoracion de prendas de vestir desde que tenia 15 años ella es reconosida por sus clientes por la calidad de prendas que confecciona, tambien ella se dedica a la elavoracion de uniformes escolares, todo los años a principios de año ella tiene mucha demanda de su clientes, porque le hacen pedidos por mayor, es por eso que ella solicita este credito para compra de tela para elavorar prendas de vestir, para damas, caballeros y niñoz, y uniformes escolares, el sueño de ella es poder agrandar mas su negocio y poder surtir su mercaderia a sus clientes y a si segir ayudando a su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en: Maria Teresa Albertina is 64 years old, married, and has a son.  She works making clothing and has done so since she was 15 years old.  She is well-known by her customers for the quality of the clothing that she makes.  She also makes school uniforms and at the beginning of every year, she has a lot of demand from her customers because they make wholesale orders.  This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase fabric to make the clothing for women, men and children, as well as school uniforms.  Her dream is to expand her business and to be able to stock her merchandise for her customers in order to continue to help her family and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing items and school uniforms

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
el señor Francisco A. tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado y ya no tiene hijos que dependen de el, Francisco se dedica a la venta de pan, vende los dias lunes a sabado, viaja a diferentes barrios, colonias y  alrededores de Nacaome, su producto lo transporta en su carro, desde muy temprano visita pulperias y otros negocios para 
entregar su producto. 
su meta a corto plazo es tener otro vehiculo para comercializar el pan a mas lugares donde actualmente no ha llegado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pan.
texts.en:
Francisco A. is 60 years old, married, and no longer has any dependent children.  His business is selling bread.  He makes his sales from Monday to Saturday, traveling to different neighborhoods, residential districts and the outskirts of Nacaome to deliver his products.

His short-term goal is to own another vehicle with which he could sell his bread in more places.  He will use his current loan to buy bread.

loans.use: To buy buns and white bread

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis tiene 36 años tiene un hijo de tres años de edad al cual le pasa una pension mensual Luis actualmente se encuentra separado vive solo en casa de su hermana ubicado en la Urb Santo Domingo el se dedica al transporte aproximadamente diez años actualemte cuenta con un vehiculo propio, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de radio base para su auto, se le otorga el credito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Luis is 36 years old and has a 3 year-old son who he provides with a monthly allowance.  Luis is currently separated and lives alone in his sister's house which is located in Santo Domingo development.  Luis has been providing transport services for approximately 10 years.  He currently owns his own vehicle and will use his loan to buy a two-way radio for this vehicle.  He is being provided with a loan because he has good references and he also has both the will and ability to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy a two-way radio

loans.name: Salmos 91 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Salmos 91 esta ubicado en el barrio la Cruz de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, cada uno de los integrantes tienen su propio negocio, son muy unidos y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Maria Lidia G. tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo, Maria tiene una pequeña pulperia y tambien produce tortillas , por las mañanas hasta las dos de la tarde atiende la pulperia y despues elabora y vende tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir la pulperia.

la señora Reyna Isabel G. tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos, Reyna se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas y tambien cria cerdos. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal para tener mas produccion de tortillas.
El sueño de Reyna es tener su casa, ahora ya tiene un solar en donde va a construir.

el señor Jose Francisco G. tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltero pero tiene dos hijos que dependen de el,  Jose vive en casa de su madre y se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de pescado blanco, rojo y babosa.\
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado. hace poco compro un carro en donde transporta el producto y esto le facilita sus ventas. en estos momentos se queda sin producto rapido y tiene que viajar hasta donde venden el pescado para seguir vendiendo, esto le ocaciona perdidas en tiempo y dinero pudiendo comprar mas por semana y llenar su carro de pescado.
texts.en:
The group 'Salmos 91' ('Psalms 91) is located in the suburb of La Cruz in the city of San Lorenzo. Each one of the members has their own business. They are very close and determined to move forward in life. Each one carries out different activities, which are as follows: 

Maria Lidia G. is 33 years of age, married and has three children who rely on her and her husband. Maria runs a small local store and also makes tortillas. She works in the store each morning until 2pm and afterwards she makes and sells tortillas. She will use this loan to purchase groceries to stock up her store.

Reyna Isabel G. is 47 years of age and a single mother to four children. Reyna makes and sells tortillas and also raises pigs. She will use this loan to purchase corn, wood and lime to increase her tortilla production. Reyna's dream is to have her own home, now that she has a site where she will build her house. 

Jose Francisco G. is 38 years of age and single, but he has two children who rely on him for support. Jose lives in his mother's house and he has sold white fish, red fish and aloe vera plants for the past year. He will use this loan to purchase fish. A little while ago he purchased a car to transport his products and this made his sales easier. At the moment he is quickly running out of products to sell and he has to drive to the area where the fish is sold to keep reselling them, which means that he loses time and money. With this loan he will be able to purchase enough fish to fill up his car each week.

loans.use: Purchase of white fish, red fish, aloe vera plants, corn, wood, lime, beans, rice, sugar, soap, toilet paper, bread, soft drinks, churros, cornflour, butter, oil and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Mártir de 33 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa, ellos aun no tienen hijos; Mártir se dedica a la crianza de ganado, oficio que aprendió por sus padres, este trabajo no tiene horario fijo por lo que depende de él cuanto tiempo le dedicara.
Él se le presenta la oportunidad de adquirir más ganado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra, este préstamo le ayudara a aprovechar la inversión y aumentar el número de ganado en sus tierras.
Su propósito como ganadero es mantener en sus rebaños la mejor ganadería que se pueda, para comercializarla al mejor precio, manteniendo estable su condición económica y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mártir, 33 years old, lives in Corinto, department of Morazon, where he lives with his wife. They still don't have any children. Martir raises livestock, something that he learned from his parents. This work does not have a fixed schedule because he decides how much time to dedicate.

He has the opportunity to acquire more livestock, which is why he's requesting a loan to make the purchase. This loan will help him with the investment and grow the number of livestock he has on his land.

His purpose as a rancher is to keep livestock on the best ranch he can manage, to sell at the best price, and maintain a stable financial situation for him and his wife.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy footwear wholesale

loans.name: Jessy

texts.es:
Jessy Guzman G., es un emprendedor preocupado por la salud de sus vecinos.
Es por eso que hace  4 años inicio con la venta de productos naturales  medicinales, un negocio que la ha permitido salir adelante y ayudar a las personas de su comunidad. El necesita comprar mas producto para abastastecer  la demanda que cada vez es mayor, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de  ₡598000 (Quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones). 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
Jessy Guzman G. is an entrepreneur who is concerned about his neighbors’ health. This is why he began to sell natural medicinal products four years ago, a business that has allowed him to get ahead and to help the people of his community. He needs to buy more products to meet the growing demand, which is why he needs a loan of 598,000 Costa Rican Colones (CRC).

He is a member of the Canalete Communal Loan Company (Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete), one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal products

loans.name: Juan Eustacio

texts.es:
Juan, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 39 años y vive solo, está soltero,  se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de granos básicos, este oficio lo aprendió de niño ayudando a su padre a sembrar, por el momento Juan tiene toda la producción de su siembra y debe pagar mozos para la recolección y almacenamiento, por lo que solicita un préstamo para el pago de los trabajadores que le ayudaran a realizar el proceso.
Con este préstamo podrá dar empleo a varias personas para que ayuden a recoger y guardar toda la producción que obtuvo de su siembra de maíz, además de que estos alimentos estarán listos para prepararse.
El quiere seguir con la ayuda de préstamos para continuar en el trabajo de campo y proveer alimentación.
texts.en:
Juan lives in Corinto, in the Department of Morazán, El Salvador. He is 39, single, and lives alone. Juan works planting and selling staple food grains, a job that he learned as a child by helping his father with planting. Right now Juan's crops are ready to harvest and he needs to hire workers to help harvest and store them. He is asking for a loan to pay these workers to help him finish the job. 

The money from this loan will allow Juan to employ various people to help him harvest his entire corn crop and put it into safe storage. Once harvested, these crops will be ready to be used as food. Juan would like to continue to get loans in order to keep working in agriculture and provide food to others.

loans.use: To pay for workers to help in the harvest of crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria M. G. es conocida por ser una excelente vendedora, en la Canalete de Alajuela.
Aprovechando sus habilidades decidió   empezar su negocio de ventas por catalogo, en donde vende todo tipos de  productos, desde electrodomésticos,  hasta productos de uso personal y ropa que ella misma confecciona.
En este momento ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡598000 (Quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de más productos  con el fin de  generar mayor diversidad  y mayores ganancias  para su negocio. 
Ella es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Maria is known for being an excellent saleswoman in the Canalete de Alajuela. Taking advantage of her abilities, she decided to begin her business selling everything from electrical appliances to personal use items and clothing that she makes herself. 

She is requesting a loan of 598000 colones to buy more products with the goal of having greater variety and generating more income for her business. She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: Evarista casada, comerciante y agricultora, emprendedora, inicio su negocio con esfuerzo propio, tiene en proyecto mejorar el sistema eléctrico de la vivienda así también la diversificación de la finca con el cultivo rentable. Desde  hace tiempo atrás atenido ese proyecto pero por algunas dificultades que s ele ha presentado como la enfermedades y plagas que atacan a los cultivo ha invertido en productos de prevención. El préstamo que solicitad es para ser utilizado en la compra de Insumos y Fertilizantes para ser aplicado a los cultivos. Obteniendo productos de calidad  para venderlo a mejor precio y en mayores cantidad.
texts.en:
Evarista is a married woman.  She is a saleswoman, a farmer and an entrepreneur who started her business through her own efforts.

Evarista has a project to improve the electrics in her home and also to diversify her farm with profitable crops.  She has had this project for some time but she has faced some difficulties such as diseases and infestations which have attacked her crops and she has invested in preventative products.

Evarista is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crops.  This will help her obtain high-quality produce that she can sell in larger quantities and for a better price.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PAY FOR THE INSTALLATION OF ELECTRICAL ENERGY IN HIS HOME

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra D. 32, resiD. en Moncagua departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su hija D. 4 años D. edad, se dedica a vender lociones y cosméticos, el negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia desD. hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días D. 7:00am a 4:00pm, por el momento necesita solicitar un préstamo para comprar cosméticos y lociones para la venta.
Esta inversión la hará con el propósito D. ampliar la variedad en productos para ofrecer a los clientes y tener la oportunidad D. aumentar sus ventas adquiriendo mejores ingresos para el sustento del hogar.
Su aspiración  es mantenerse activa en el negocio, proveer para su hogar todo lo necesario y ayudar a su hija para que crezca sanamente y se forme académicamente.
texts.en:
Sandra, 32, lives with her 4 year-old daughter in Moncagua in the department of San Miguel.  She has a business selling lotions and cosmetics.  She founded this business by her own initiative 10 years ago.  She works every day from 7am to 4pm.  At this time she needs to request a loan to buy cosmetics and lotions to sell.

She will make this investment with the goal of expanding the range of products that she has to offer her customers, so that she can increase her sales, thereby earning a higher income to support her household.

Her goal is to remain active in the business, providing everything needed for her home and helping her daughter so that she can grow up healthy and have a good education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snack foods, softdrinks, cookies and cooking items

loans.name: Mujeres De Pachawacan 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Gumercinda I., de 26 años de edad, es una señora casada tiene dos hijos, una nena y niño, doña Eufemia trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales, con esa actividad ella  ha podido  mantener,  a su familia, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 5 años, doña Eufemia se dio cuenta que necesitaba comprar  mas animales para poder mejorar las ventas, y tratar la manera de apoyar a su comunidad vendiéndoles huevos de la gallinas, y así de esa manera ella puede obtener un poco mas de ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de  ocho años, para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su aldea, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, elaboración de camisolas y pantalonetas, pants blusas, venta de mercería, entre otros.
texts.en: Doña Eufemia Gumercinda I. is 26 years old, married and has two children, a girl and a boy.  She tries to support her family financially and provide a better future for her children.  She has been raising animals for a living for more than 5 years and has been able to support her family with this activity.  Doña Eufemia realized that she needed to buy more animals to improve her sales.  She also brings in a little more income selling eggs which also helps to support her community.  She met with some neighbors that she has known for more than eight years to invite them to form this group as she tries to support not only her family, but also her community.  All the women earn a living working at various different jobs such as fruit sales, raising animals, seamstress, merchandise sales, etc.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Jose Hernaides

texts.es:
José, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares y accesorios, trabajaba junto a un amigo en esta área lo que le permitió aprender e instalar su propio negocio que tiene ya 6 años de existir.
Por el momento su dificultad es la falta de accesorios para celulares por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión ayudando así a fortalecer el inventario de artículos y ofreciendo a los clientes una variedad productos.
El aspira algún día tener un puesto adecuado y propio, poder independizarse de los prestamos produciendo de sus mismas ganancias para progresar en esta actividad.
texts.en: José is 25 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with his wife and 4-year-old daughter. He makes a living selling and repairing cellular phones and accessories. He worked along with a friend in the area, which allowed him to learn and set up his own business, which he has now had for six years. At the moment, he is lacking cell phone accessories, and he is requesting the loan so he can invest in strengthening his inventory and offering his customers a variety of products. He hopes one day to have a fit and proper sales post so he can become independent from the loan cycles and rely on his own earnings to keep progressing in this activity.

loans.use: Purchase cell phone accessories

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro S.: trabaja todos los dias en el campo sembrando mora y maiz tiene hijos que mantener ya que estan en edad escolar a parte de eso cultiva cafe maduro y lo vende por quintal, tambien vende carbon por costales es asi como obtiene ganancias solicita el credito para abono organico y plantas de cafe para sembrar su sueño es tener un local donde vender su producto.
texts.en: Pedro S. works everyday in the field growing blackberries and corn. He has children to take care of since they are of school age. Pedro also grows coffee and sells it by the quintal [1 quintal = 46 kg], he also sells coal by the sack and that is how he earns his way. Pedro needs the loan to buy organic manure and coffee plants to grow. His dream is to have a stall to sell his products.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and coffee plants to grow.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo ocupación comerciante y agricultor, hombre trabajador mira la necesidad de mejor su vivienda con mucho esfuerzo y apoyo de su familia tiene su finca. Iniciando desde muy joven,  siendo su medio de trabajo. Se  presentado dificultades como robo del productos, plagas y enfermedades siendo generadores de perdida. Planes para el negocio es diversificar la finca con el producto. Con este préstamo comprara los Insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para producir mayores cantidades con calidad. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo como agrícola.
texts.en: Arturo is a merchant and an agriculturist. He is a hard working man who sees the need to improve their home. With a great deal of effort and with his family's support he manages a plantation. He started out when he was very young in what has become his business. Difficulties such as the theft of the produce, plagues and blights have resulted in a loss. He has plans to diversify his plantation with different products. This loan will be used to purchase materials and fertilizers needed to stimulate larger yields. He is thankful to the organization for supporting him in his development as a farmer.

loans.use: To purchase materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new car to sell her food items
