She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make hers their number one sari-sari store in the community.

Alicia has learned the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate hers. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Additional stock for her variety store

loans.name: Parniati

texts.en:
Parniati is a 50-year-old lady. She is originally from Jombang, East Java – another province in Indonesia. She is married to Yadi, a 53-year-old man who is running a furniture business on a small scale. Parnati and Yadi have been blessed with two children: Siswoyo and Abdi. Both have graduated from school and are currently living in Jakarta. 

Parniati is running a food-stall business in Lili Market, about a 40-minute drive from Kupang City. She has been running this business for five years to support her husband, as his income from selling furniture is unstable as a result of expensive raw materials. Initially, Parniati aimed to run a second-hand clothes business, but this business will require her to move from one market to another market according to the market schedule. She then decided to run a food-stall business as she realized that not so many people run a similar business at the Lili Market, which is situated not far from her residence. 

To run the business, Paniati borrowed money from a cooperative with daily repayment. The interest rate charged was quite high, but Parniati didn’t have another option. Due to the limited capital that she has, Parniati couldn’t improve her business. She then heard about TLM's lending program and got interested in joining the program for its monthly repayment and achievable interest rate. 

Parniati is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. Parniati plans to add more menus in her food stall, expand her food stall and buy a new table for the food stall. Parniati really hopes that the loan can help her to improve the business.

loans.use: To add more menus, expand the food stall and buy a new table

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 47 years old. Elena is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elena runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Rowena B., 35, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for herself and her family. She finished her high-school education and is married to Renante B., her business partner. They have been blessed with two children, both of whom are in high school now. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines. Rowena presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store that caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Alongside this, she also manages their own mineral-water refilling station, which is located adjacent to their house. With the help of her husband, they were able to raise at least a minimum gross sales of around 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every day. To help her continue operation of her business, she decided to borrow 16,000 PHP. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer for her store. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make hers their number one sari-sari store in the community. Rowena learned the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate hers. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goals she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled. She also looks forward to having their own house and lot someday. As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Additional stock for her variety store

loans.name: Segundo Teodoro

texts.es:
Segundo es una padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa a sus vecinos y personas que llegan a la zona.  Asimismo de dedica a la  crianza y venta de aves de corral. Él cría gallinas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y alimento balanceado y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente él desea adquirir más alimento para sus gallinas y así  poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 53-year old father who lives together with his wife and son in one of the communities that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region that is primarily known for its fruit products, especially mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He sells general merchandise from a small store installed in his house. He sells to his neighbors and to people in the region. He also raises and sells chickens. He raises chickens at home, feeding them basic grains and balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income, which is why he always tries to manage it in the best way possible. 

He needs to purchases more feed for his chickens in order to increase his sales and his earnings. IN order to reach his objective he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced chicken feed.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro es una padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus 5  hijos en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino y vacuno. Él cría a los animales en su domicilio, los alimenta en base a alimento balanceado y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.  Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra maíz y arroz en tiempo de campaña.

Actualmente ella desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lazaro is a 53-year old father who lives together with his wife and their 5 children in a community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region that is primarily known for its fruit products, especially mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He raises and sells goats and cattle. He raises his livestock on his property, feeding them balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in their development he offers them for sales to merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income, which is why he tries to manage it the best way possible. He is also an agriculturist who cultivates corn and rice during the growing season. 

He requires more balanced feed for his livestock in order to increase his sales and his earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Verónica se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Verónica desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Verónica is 32 years old, she is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Tambogrande, a district of the Piura province, located in the region by the same name whose main characteristic is the fact that its inhabitants mainly engage in growing fruits.

Verónica engages in selling beauty products by catalogue. She can count on a group of customers who frequently buy her products: the more requests she satisfies the more points she gains form the company that supplies her with the products, consequently earning more. This is why she constantly works hard to win more customers.

Verónica wishes to increase her stock of beauty products in order to satisfy the requests she is currently receiving, and for this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa B. is from the village of Bacnor West.  She is 44 years old.  Marissa is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as vegetables in the local community.  Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Marissa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her child. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret M. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Margret has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use a computer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Zulaika has a tailoring business, designing and making clothes. She has been engaged in this business for one year.
To help expand her business, Zulaika has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more material for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Zulaika hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Zulaika is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her to be hardworking and showing her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more material for making clothes for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline K. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Caroline has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and also open a small restaurant which will sell food and drink. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become a nurse. Caroline is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be patient in life and how to work hard so that she is able to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and also open a small restaurant

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Ma. Belinda is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a livestock and sugarcane farm. Her husband, Jose Danilo V., is 47 years old. He works as a welder and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. 

Ma. Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 3,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as capital for business operations. Her goal is to continue to save up for children's education in the future. Ma. Belinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and by selling vegetables. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and vegetable businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP. 

Anita is borrowing 16,000 PHP so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Esterllita

texts.en:
Esterllita is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu city. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Romeo B., who is 42 years old, works as a trisikad (pedicab) driver to earn his living. They have four children who are between the ages of 5 and 20. Esterllita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Esterllita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 22,400 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth cycle loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more inventory to sell. Her goal is to continue to save up for the future expansion of  their house and to have an additional business. Esterllita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 
 
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodrigo Franco

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo U. tiene 37 años de edad, está casado con la señora Claudia del Aguila, actualmente ellos viven junto a sus padres haciéndoles compañía, ayudándoles a tener una vejez tranquila; aunque aún no tienen hijos a su cuidado, ellos están trabajando mucho para cuando llegue el momento les puedan dar todo lo necesario. 

Ellos viven en la zona de pacata baja, muy cerca del servicio nacional de caminos.
Rodrigo es una persona muy trabajadora y junto a su esposa quieren salir adelante. Él quiere el préstamo para el equipamiento y refacción de los vehículos que cuenta para que puedan brindar un mejor servicio de transporte como taxi. Rodrigo está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de contar con mejores medios de trabajo.

Rodrigo entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para poder acceder a una vivienda propia y así goce de un mejor bienestar para él y toda su familia y espera que muy pronto sea más grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodrigo U. is 37-years old and he is married with Mrs. Claudia del Aguila. They live with his parents to help them have a quiet old age. Although they don't have any children in their care, they work very hard to have all that they need when the time comes. 

They live in the region of Pacata Baja, very close to the national transportation service.  Rodrigo is a very hard working person and he wants to get ahead, together with his wife. He requires the loan to purchase accessories and carry out the necessary repairs to the cars he has to provide a better transportation and taxi service. Rodrigo is very grateful to those individuals who, through Kiva, provided him with the opportunity to have a better source of support for his business. 

Rodrigo's plans for the future are to have a new loan to build a house of his own, to be able to provide a sense of wellbeing for himself and his family, hoping that his family will grow very soon.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and pay for repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar C. N. tiene 20años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Oscar es soltero y no tiene  hijos, por circunstancias de la vida el se vino de la ciudad de Potosi por motivos de trabajo, ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder salir adelante, Oscar se dedica desde hace mas de 1 año a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo, 

Los fines de semana el trabaja en acontecimientos festivos con su equipo de amplificacion, lo cua l le genera buenos ingresos. Oscar quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero el nos cuenta que quiere comprarse un mejor equipo de amplificación para poder alquilar, como el ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicho equipo que es nesesario para realizar la actividad. Para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Oscar  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas equipos para su amplificacion.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar C. N. is 20 years old and lives in a rented house, located in the city of Tarija. Oscar is single and he doesn't have children. He moved to the city of Potosi to look for work and now he works to support himself. For the past year Oscar has been working for a well-known company in the city, selling fast foods including roast chicken, called Crocan Pollo by the company. 

On the weekends he uses his sound system to cater special events and it is a good source of income. Oscar wants to improve his income to support himself. He says that he wants to purchase a better sound system to rent it out, given that he already has experience in the field. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a sound system which is necessary for is business. This way he will be able to increase his income. 

Oscar wants to improve the quality of his life and he says that the next loan will be used to purchase other sound systems.

loans.use: To purchase a sound system.

loans.name: Mayflor

texts.en:
Mayflor M. is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She supports her family by operating a barbeque vending business. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her barbeque vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP15,000. 

Mayflor is  borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Mayflor aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa C. is a married woman who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and an Avon dealing business.  

Her husband, Antonio C., who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 17 years old. 

Desa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Desa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, fund her child's education, do house repairs and buy home appliances. 

Desa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Sol De Los Andes Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Sol D. los andes esta conformado por 8 integrantes todas mujeres, La señora Cristina es la presidenta del banco anteriormente participo en otra banca  la cual tuvo algunos problemas internos,  y esta señora fue una excelente cliente, en relación a su puntualidad y solidaridad,  la invitamos a formar un grupo nuevo y el resultado fue la banca sol D. los andes en la cual  ella fue elegida presidenta, es D. carácter muy jovial, entusiasta y perseverante, la señora cristina tiene el negocio D. venta D. saldos D. camas, ella compra D. las fabrica D. polar los saldos y deshechos D. camas a los que les pone borD. con su maquina D. coser y posteriormente los venD. en la feria D. la zona 16 D. julio. La Sra. Cristina con el dinero del credito comprara tela por cantidad, su familia consta D.  cinco miembros  tres hijos y su esposo, quien es D. actividad múltiple, es albañil, músico y arbitro, apoya a su esposa en el sueño D. hacer construir su casita que aún están pagando.
texts.en: The Banco D. Emprendimiento Sol D. los Andes (Sun of the Andes Communal Bank) is composed of 8 female members, and Cristina is the president of the bank. She previously formed part of another bank that encountered internal problems, but since her reliability and solidarity maD. of this lady an excellent customer, she was invited to create a new group, that is the Sol D. los Andes bank, of which she was elected president. A very cheerful, enthusiastic and tenacious woman, she engages in selling bedding overstock. She buys bedding overstock and remnants from the polar fleece factory, she embroiders them with her sewing machine and then she sells them in the traD. fair located in the 16 D. Julio area. With the loan she has requested Cristina will buy stocks of fabric. Her family is composed of 5 members, herself, three children and her husband who engages in different activities: he is a mason, a musician and a referee, and he helps his wife achieving their dream of finishing building the house they are currently paying for.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fabric.

loans.name: Sonia Alba Lina

texts.es:
Sonia de 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora que por buenas decisiones es una microempresaria. Aunque esta actualmente separada ella continua trabajando. 

El inicio de su negocio fue con la venta de helados y bolos (refrescos congelados que los vacían en fundas) frente a una escuela. Poco a poco con la buena administración que le dio al dinero que ganaba comenzó a comprar víveres para vender comida y tambien con venta de bebidas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:30am hasta las 21h30pm vendiendo comidas y tiene un negocio de bebidas (aparece en la foto). 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando y comprar con el préstamo víveres y recargas celulares para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Sonia is 43 years old and she is a hard working woman and following some sound decisions she is now a small business owner. And although she recently became separated she still keeps up her business. 

She started out selling icecreams and bolos (frozen soft drinks that have been poured in bags) in front of a school. Through sound business administration and with time she earns enough money to purchase ingredients to prepare foods and to sell drinks. Currently she works from 6:30am to 9:30pm selling foods and drinks (the business is shown in the photo). 

She aspires to accomplish many things through her business, which is why she wants to keep working. The loan will be used to purchase ingredients and prepaid cell phone cards as an additional source of income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, prepaid cell phone cards, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila P. C. de 32 años de edad vive en el caserio San Juan Bautista. La Sra. tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en la cual vende los días sábados y domingos. Su sueño segun nos comenta es incrementar su negocio y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. Lucila está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Señora Lucila P. C., aged 32, lives in the hamlet of San Juan Bautista. She has a business selling clothes in which she sells on Saturdays and Sundays. Her dream, she told us, is to expand her activity so that she can give her family a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we provide through this funding.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny G. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: an oyster business and a general store. 

She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her oyster and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. 

Liny  is  borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Liny  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de verduras en la localidad de Sacaba, vive en zona el morro , es casada  tiene dos hijos pequeños,  vive en la casa de sus padres, vende los días de feria jueves y domingo su esposo es panadero, los días que no vende ayuda a su esposo en la elaboración y comercialización del pan, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de verduras por quintales,  así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo ella, es una persona joven trabajadora, su deseo es poder comprarse su casita propia y de esta manera tener mas comodidad, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Norma sells vegetables for a living in Sacaba.  She lives in the El Morro zone.  She is married and has two small children.  She lives in her parents house.  She sells her vegetables on Thursday and Sundays, market days.  He husband is a baker. On the days that she is not selling, she helps her husband make and sell bread.  She will use the loan to purchase quintales of vegetables and increase her working capital.  She is a young working woman.  Her dream is to be able to buy her own house and be more comfortable.  She is grateful to in the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase quintales of vegetables

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a carinderia (a small eatery) and a pig fattening business. Her husband Benito S., age 63, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have three children who are 18 to 27 years old.

Nora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twenty loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP helped her to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her twenty-first loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials. She plans to continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Nora is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Three of her children have their own families, the fourth is working while the other two go to school.

With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo casada su esposa ama de casa, tiene su propio negocio venta de chatarra desde hace tiempo, sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio. Proyecto mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y aumentar sus ingresos mediante las ventas. Al inicio empezó con una carreta de caballo a la actualidad tiene una camioneta obtenido mayor capacidad para la recolección de chatarra.
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, láminas de zinc, tubos, camisa de 4 y codo de 4 entre otros materiales para repellar las paredes y el cambio de techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Reynaldo is married and his wife stays at home. He has had is own business selling scrap for some time. His children help him with the business. His goal is to improve the conditions of their home and to increase their earnings through sales. He started out with a horse drawn carriage but today he has a van to collect greater quantities of scrap. With this loan he will purchase construction materials such as cement, iron rebars, zinc sheeting, tubes, and other materials needed to plaster the walls and to replace the roof of their house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
El  Señor Jhony, P. tiene 42 años vive por la zona de Sumumpaya, al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba en una zona periférica de la ciudad, se encuentra casado, tiene 3 hijas, y se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, para la elaboración de quesos, estos productos los comercializa su esposa en las ferias populares, además el Sr. Jhony y su esposa se dedican a la refaccion de sombreros para las señoras nativas del lugar.
EL señor y su esposa son muy dedicados a su familia estuvieron siempre buscando mejores ingresos, y viajaron a la Argentina en busca de oportunidades, pero la suerte no les acompaño y extrañaban mucho a sus pequeñas hijas por lo que regresaron.

Los esposos trabajan de forma coordinada, mientras uno corta pasto el otro lleva a las vacas para ordeñar, y cuando preparan el producto (quesos) para vender uno se queda a cuidar el pastoreo de las vacas y mientras vende los quesos también vende los sobreros.

Siempre están pensando en superarse y generar mas ingresos para que sus hijas tengan una mejor condición de vida, ahora desean provechar y comprar alimento para su ganado antes que empiece a escasear y suba de precio, por ese motivo se apersonaron a solicitar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhony P. is 42 years old and he lives in the region of Sumupaya, to the west of the city of Cochabamba. It is a suburban region to the city.  He is married and he is the father of 3 daughters. He is produces raw milk and it is used in the production of cheeses. His wife sells these products at the large fairs. Jhony and his wife also make hats that are traditionally worn by women in the region. 

He and his wife are very dedicated to their family. They have always been in search of better earnings and they traveled to Argentina for better opportunities. But luck was not on their side and they missed their young daughters too much so they returned back home. 

This married couple travels in an organized way. While one cut down some say, the other milks the cows. And when they prepare cheeses for sale, one always stays behind to shepherd the cows.  And while one is out selling cheeses the other is out selling sombreros. 

They are always looking for a way to improve them and to generate more income to provide their daughters with a better quality of life.  They want to purchase feed for their cattle before it starts selling out and before the prices start to rise. To this end they have requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his dairy cows.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4000 PHP.

Remedios is borrowing 25,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her twenty-first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Remedios aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by selling Tupper Ware and cosmetics. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).  

Cherry is borrowing 8,000 PHP to purchase more items to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Cherry aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a ready-to-wear clothing business. She lives in Bago City in the province of Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9000 PHP.

Helen is borrowing 10,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Mery Tatiana

texts.es:
Mery de 18 años, es una joven emprendedora que desde los 16 años empezó con su negocio para no depender de un empleador y tener su propio capital de trabajo. Con ahorros y algunos créditos ha surtido su tienda. 

Desde que comenzó su tienda ha estado trabajando con su abuela para tener mas tiempo y surtir con mas mercadería su tienda. En la tienda atiende en horarios rotativos y vende arroz, aceite, azúcar etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar con él y así ayudar con los gastos familiares. Necesita comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, detergentes, bebidas para surtir la tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un despensa grande y surtir con mucha mercadería su tienda para cubrir con las expectativas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mery is 18 years old, she is a young entrepreneur who started her own activity at 16 years of age in order not to depend on an employer and to count on her own working capital. She has furnished her shop thanks to her savings and to some loans.

Since she has opened her shop, she has been working with her grandmother in order to have more time and to equip her shop with more products. She works in her shop according to a rotating schedule, and she sells rice, oil, sugar and other items. She has many ambitions for her shop, and for this reason she wants to maintain I, thus being able to help paying for family expenses. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, detergents and drinks to furnish her shop.

In the future she wants to have a big pantry and equip her shop with many products in order to meet her customers’ expectations.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and drinks.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a business buying and selling Lapu-Lapu Fish, a sari-sari (general) store, and a public utility vehicle business. Her husband Alex L., age 33, works as a fish vendor, a driver, and a barangay (village) councilor to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 1 to 10 years old.

Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks of Lapu-Lapu Fish. She plans to continue saving up for assets in order to have a better future. The picture shows Liza together with her husband in their Lapu-Lapu Fish business. Liza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of Lapu-Lapu Fish

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 46-year old widow who supports her family by operating a restaurant. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 34,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).  

Analie is  borrowing 25,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  

Analie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.
