Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma E. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Oguis, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by fattening pigs and with an abaca [fiber from abaca palm leaf] weaving business. Her husband, Eduardo E., age 53, works as a construction worker and also helps with his wife's business. They have three children who are 11 to 16 years old. One has a family while the other two are going to school. Delma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Delma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and vitamins so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Delma E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jarvin Ramon

texts.es:
Don Jarvin Ramon U., es habitante de la Comarca Jamali en Palacaguina; teine 36 anos de edad, esta casado con 3 hijos, por falta de recursos alcanzo unicamente el segundo grado.
Desde los 16 anos de edad, el ayuda  a sus padres en la siembra de Hortalizas, pero tambien posee experiencia en la siembra d granos basicos y un poco de Ganaderia.
Tiene un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos y le envia Remesas Familiares, para ayudarse un poco.
Realizo este Credito para Compra de Insumos para la Siembra de Tomates, espera que esta cosecha sea muy productiva, y obtener buenas ganancias, el cree que sino fuese por este credito que le esta inyectando capital, no podria trabajar.
Su proxima meta es poder mejorar su vivienda y expandir su produccion a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Jarvin Ramon U. lives in Comarca Jamali in Palacaguina. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. For the lack of resources he only went to school until second grade. Since he was 16 years old he helped his parents work in the plantations but he also has some experience in cultivating basic grains and some livestock farming. 

He has a brother who lives in the USA and he sends money for the family to contribute. 

He requests this loan to purchase materials he needs to cultivate tomatoes. He hopes to have a very productive harvest and to obtain a good profit. He believes that without this loan he would not be able to keep up his business. 

His next goal is to improve his home and to distribute his products to other markets.

loans.use: To invest in his tomato plantation.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
El senor Alfredo M., tiene 61 anos de edad, vive en el Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, casado y tiene solamente 1 hijo; con mas de 50 anos de dedicarse a la agricultura y a la ganaderia.
Inicio en estas actividades desde la edad de 10 anos, ayudando a  su Papa; sembrando granos basicos, y tambien su Papa tenia un poco de Ganado; esa fue la experiencia que logro alcanzar, nunca realizon en toda su vida otro tipo de negocio o de actividades.
En la actualidad el senor M., ha invertido mas en la Ganaderia que en la agricultura;
Don Alfredo solicito este credito, para invertirlo en su Finca, para mejorar un poco su infraestructura, como por ejemplo el Alambrado y tambien para la compra de Pastos, sobretodo para garantizar la comida de su ganado, para que este no tenga que salir a buscar comida.
Su meta es comprar una picadora para hacer rendir mas la alimentaion de su ganado y asi lograr una mejor productividad, sobre todo en los volumenes de Leche y mejorar de esta manera su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo M. is 61 years old and he lives in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo. He is married and he has only one son. He has more than 50 years' experience in agriculture and farming. He started in when he was 10 years old, helping out his father to sow basic grains. His father also had a few cattle. This was the experience he managed to acquire and never in his life has he ever worked in another field of work or employment. 

Mr. M. has recently invested more in cattle farming than in agriculture. He requests a loan to invest in his plantations to improve the infrastructure, meaning the wire fencing and to purchase grasses to supply his herd of cattle with feed. He would otherwise have to go and look for feed. His goal is to purchase a mill to make the feed for his cattle last longer and to improve productivity, especially in terms of milk production. This is an effort to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To invest in his cultivation and on his herd of cattle.

loans.name: Johana Lourdes

texts.es:
La Senora Johana, habita en la ciudad de Esteli, tiene 27 anos de edad, casada y tiene un hijo.
Ella se dedica a la compra/venta de Frutas, tiene 10 anos de dedicarse a este negocio, pues por las condiciones economicas de su familia, se vio obligada a trabajar desde esa edad; su Mama tambien se dedica a este tipo de negocio, y a traves de ella se incorporo tambien a estas actividades. Poco a poco con la poca ayuda que su Mama le logro dar, tambien estudiaba agronomia.
Ha logrado ella poco a poco recoger un poco de dinero y tambien ha puesto un pequeno negocio de venta de accesorios de celulares.
Decidio solicitar este credito, para compra de frutas, pues en esta temporada los estudiantes entran a clases y es una mayor demanda para ella; espera con este financiamiento, poder surtir un poco mejor su pequeno negocio.
Su meta, es ir creciendo y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Johana lives in the town of Esteli. She is 27 years old, she i married and has one child.
She engages in buying and selling fruits. She has been engaging in this activity for 10 years and she has been obliged to start working at that time because of the economic conditions of her family. Her mother also engages in this line of trade, and thanks to her she got involved as well in these activities. Little by little, also counting on a little help from her mother, she is also studying agricultural sciences.
Little by little she has succeeded in saving some money, and she has also established a small shop where she sells mobile phone accessories.
She decided to ask for a loan to buy fruits, because at this time of year the requests are high as students go back to school. With this loan she hopes to furnish her small shop in a better way.
Her goal is to keep on growing and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fruits to furnish her shop.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El senor Javier A., tiene 40 anos de edad, habita en la comarca Palo Verde, del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo en Jinotega, situado al norte de Esteli, soltero y con 2 hijos.
Don Javier tiene mas de 20 anos de experiencia en las actividades agricolas, pero tambien en la compra/venta de granos basicos.
Actualmente es independiene en sus negocios, sus ingresos se centran en estas 2 actividades principalmente; el recuerda que el inicio por cuenta propia, pero recibio Asistencia Tecnica de una Casa Comercial llamada PROAGRO y esto le ayudo mucho a tecnificar y ampliar sus conocimientos.
Realizo este credito para el financiamiento de Siembra de Tomate, cree que es muy importante este tipo de credito, porque son la base o parte fundamental de las personas q se dedican a este negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier A. is 40 years old and lives in Palo Verde county in the town of Pueblo Nuevo in Jinotega which is north of Esteli.  He is single with two children.

Javier has more than 20 years' experience in crop farming and in buying and selling staple grains.  He has his own business and his income is based on two main activities.  He established his own business with technical assistance from a company called PROAGRO.  This allowed him to broaden his skills and knowledge.

He is using this loan to finance his tomato crop.  He believes this type of credit is very important since it is the basis for people like himself who do this type of work.

loans.use: For tomato crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, soap, oil, softdrinks and chicken

loans.name: Oracio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Senor Oracio B., habita en la comarca El Regadillo, casado,con 4 hijos, se dedica a la Compra/Venta de Ganado.
Inicio su experiencia en las actividades ganaderas, desde la corta edad de 10 anos, el recuerda que le ayudaba a su Papa arriando los Bueyes, tambien ayudaba a cortar Cana; pero al mismo tiempo hizo un enorme sacrificio para esudiar, y logro llegar a 6to grado de Primaria.
Por dedicarse mas tiempo a ayudar a sus Papa, abandono la escuela y se dedico por completo a las actividades del campo.
A los 15 anos de edad, inicio su experiencia en la agricultura, sembrando Maiz y Frijoles, y con esto el se ayudaba con sus gastos personales, al mismo tiempo fue recogiendo un poco de dinero y logro ahorrar para comprarse su primer vaca.
Cuando alcanzo la mayoria de edad, hizo sus primeros creditos creditos en las Microfinancieras, con el terreno de su Papa.
Actualmente cuenta con un terreno que logro comprar con el tiempo y el que le dejo de herencia su papa, compro una casita humilde, y se dedica de lleno a la compra/venta de Ganado y en epoca de cosecha cultiva Tomate y Maiz.
Solicito este financiamiento para capital de compra/venta de Ganado.
Su meta es ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan llegar a la universidad y puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida; y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mr. Oracio B. lives in El Regadillo county.  He is married, with four children, and buys and sells cattle.  He began his livestock farming activity when he was only 10 years old.  He remembers how he helped his father prepare the fields with the oxen and how he would help cut cane.  But he also made an enormous effort to study and was able to reach 6th grade.

Since he had to dedicate more time to helping his dad he had to leave school and spend all his time in the fields.  At age 15 he began growing corn and beans which helped with his personal expenses.  He was able to save some money and buy his first cow.

When he became an adult he took out his first loans through micro financing using his father's land.  He was able to buy his own land and also has what he inherited from his father.  He bought a modest house and now buys and sells livestock full time.  He also grows tomato and corn every season.

He plans to use this loan to buy and sell more cattle.  His goal is to help his children go to college so they can improve their quality of life.  He also wants to make home improvements little by little.

loans.use: To buy/sell livestock

loans.name: Carmen Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen R. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como Secretaria en un colegio de primaria y secundaria en dicho municipio desde hace doce años. Es madre soltera y con dos hijos a los que trata de brindarles un mejor nivel de vida. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es suministrarles todos las cosas personales y útiles escolares a sus dos hijos ya que se aproxima la entrada a clases, por tal razón decidió solicitar su primer crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de uniformes, zapatos y útiles escolares con el fin de dar a sus hijos todo lo necesario para su formación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen R. is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and has worked as a secretary at the primary and secondary school there for 12 years.  She is a single mother with two children for whom she tries to provide an appropriate lifestyle.

She now has to buy all the personal and school materials for her two children to start school soon, so she is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to buy school uniforms, shoes and materials.  She hopes to give them all they need for their education.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms, shoes and materials

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: EL Sr. Eleuterio R. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conductor de una ambulancia en el municipio desde hace 14 años, cabe mencionar que el Sr. R. también se dedica a la agricultura  en donde cosecha maíz y frijoles en su propia finca ubicada en el municipio. Es casado y con cinco hijos a los que trata de brindarles un mejor nivel de vida. Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es adquirir insumos necesario para la siembra de granos como maíz y frijoles, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener ingresos gracias a la comercialización de los mismos para darles un mejor nivel de vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio Ramirez is from the town of El Sauce.  He has worked there as an ambulance driver for 14 years.  Mr. Ramirez is also a crop farmer and grows corn and beans on his own farm located in the town.

He is married with five children for whom he tries to provide the best lifestyle.  He needs to buy seeds for his next corn and bean crops and is therefore requesting his third loan through Ceprodel.  He hopes to raise enough money from the crop sales to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María Elena D. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica a atender su propio negocio que consiste en una pequeña  pulpería  desde hace cinco años. La Sra. ha demostrado tener un buen comportamiento en sus pagos durante los cuatro años que tiene de trabajar con nuestra institución, el crédito lo solicito para surtir mas su negocio ya que se avecina la entrada a clases y ella abastece las necesidades de los alumnos, maestros ya que su negocio está ubicado cerca del colegio de su comunidad ofreciéndoles golosinas, también comidas rápidas  como enchiladas, bigoron entre otros derivados alimenticios.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena D. is from the town of El Sauce.  She has been operating a small grocery store for the last five years.  María has been very good at paying back loans to our institution over the last four years.  

She plans to use this loan to stock her business since school is about to begin and she sells to the students and teachers there.  Her store is close to the community school where she sells sweets, fast food such as enchiladas, and other food items.

loans.use: To buy sweets, rice, sugar and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sand, cement, lumber, iron, wire, panels, nails, zinc and to pay workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Paulita Candida

texts.es:
Paulita mujer emprendedora, casada y con proyectos de mejora su vivienda y condiciones de vida. Tienen su propio negocio una pulpería en donde vende variedad de productos de uso cotidiano. 
Lo inicio con apoyo de su esposo, se le ha presentado la dificulta de recurso económico para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. Agradece a la financiera que atreves de ella le ha brindado el apoyo para aumentar su inventario. 
Sus planes a futuro es convertir su pulpería en miscelánea. Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara cosméticos, ropas, accesorios, útiles escolares, productos básico arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite entre otros productos. Siendo  de gran beneficio al obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Paulita is an enterprising woman, married, and with plans to improve their house and their living conditions. She has her own convenience store business where she sells a variety of daily use products. She started out with her husband’s support. She has been faced with the financial difficulty of providing her clients for their needs. She is thankful to the organization that has supported her in increasing her inventory. 

Her plans for the future are to convert her convenience store into a market. With the loan that she requests she will purchase cosmetics, clothing, accessories, school supplies, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other products. She has seen a great benefit in obtaining more products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Olaya Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

La señora Olaya  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque los intereses son bajos. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16,  15 y 11 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es agente vendedor.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en la cual vende cervezas, sodas, aguas y también vende tarjetas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 21h 00, ella  nos cuenta que lleva en sus negocio el mismo tiempo que lleva en el Banco y por esta razón está muy agradecida con la institución ya que gracias a estos créditos ella puede sacar su negocio adelante y que con todos los créditos recibidos ha ido poco a poco agrandando su negocio. Todos sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cervezas, colas, aguas entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The partners of the Communal Bank of Bellevista meet in the city of Bellavista de  Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos.

Señora Olaya is a founding partner of this communal bank which she likes because of the additional benefits of Fundación ESPOIR and because of the low interest rates. She is 43 years old and is married with three children, ages 16,15 and 11. All three of her children are in school and her husband is a salesman.

The Señora has a small business in her house to sell beer, soda, water and also various phone cards. She works everyday from seven in the morning until nine at night.  She told us that she started her business at the same time that she began working with the bank and this is why she is so grateful to Fundación ESPOIR. Thanks to these loans she has been able to improve her business and with each loan she has received she has been slowly expanding her business. All of her products she buys locally. 

This loan she will use to buy beer, soda, water and a few other things. She dreams that her children will have a very good education and will have good jobs.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, los mismos que estudian en universidad y que  aún viven con ella. Su esposo es médico veterinario y trabaja en la Universidad Laica en Manta.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque comenta que también sus clientes llegan a su casa a observar y comprar los productos los mismos que deja a  crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. La ropa y zapatos los compra una parte en Guayaquil y lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos  son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un carro y un bazar.
texts.en:
In the city of Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capitl of Manabí, long known as the city of the Reales Tamarindos, meet the members of the Communal Bank. 

This is where we met Señora Fátima, she is 55 years old and is married. She and her husband have two older children who both study at the university but live with them. Her husband is a medical veterinarian and he works at the University Laica en Manta.

Señora Fátima is a housewife and to increase her own resources she sells clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for ladies). She works three days a week, selling door to door but she also reports that her clients come to her house to see and buy her products, these customers pay with credit or charge every week or the 15th of every month, whichever agreement her clients prefer. The clothes and shoes she buys in Guayaquil and the Yanbal products are sent to her house.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, shoes, and clothes. This is Señora Fátima's fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank, she likes working with the bank because the loans are easy to make. Her dream is to have a car and her own store.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, shoes, and clothes.

loans.name: Dolores Eulalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los pagos son cómodos y fáciles de cumplir. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de  edad, su hija vive en su casa y  estudia en universidad. Su marido es chofer.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Su hija le ayuda con las ventas ya que lleva los productos a la Universidad donde ella estudia y les vende a sus compañeras de clase. Nos cuenta que los perfumes y la bisutería es lo que más vende, aunque dice que todo se vende porque es un gran producto.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Sus sueños son tener una boutique y que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo -- the capital de Manabí province, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds" -- the members of the "Risen Christ" Communal Bank hold their meetings. 

Dolores is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments have good terms and are easy to fulfill. She is 43 years old and has a common-law husband. She has two children from this relationship who are already grown. Her daughter lives at home and attends the university. Her husband is a driver. 

She is a housewife, but to obtain her own resources, she works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day of the week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week or every two weeks, according to her customers' desires. Her daughter helps her with the sales, taking the products to the university where she studies and selling them to her classmates. She reports that the perfumes and costume jewelry are most popular, although she says that everything sells, because they are great products. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Her dreams are to have her own boutique and to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: Buying creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Sonia Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Sonia, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es taxista.
 
Se dedica a la venta zapatos, carteras, sabanas y productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja cuatro días de la semana desde las 8h30 hasta las 11h00, ya que tiene que ir a hacer el almuerzo para sus hijos y en las tardes se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos en sus tareas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente dice que le encanta vender. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y lo que es por catálogos lo recibe en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar carteras, ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución. Sus sueños son poder obtener un título profesional ya que espera en este año empezar a estudiar.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Cristo Resucitado" meet in the Libertad #2 district of the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí and which has been known for many years as the city of the magnificent tamarinds.

In this place we find Señora Sonia, who is 33 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has three children of ages 10, 8, and 3 years. The oldest two are in school. Her husband drives a taxi.

She sells shoes, wallets, sheets, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), in addition to clothing from catalogs. She works four days a week from 8:30 to 11:00, since she has to go make lunch for her children, and in the afternoons she helps her children with their homework. She sells door to door and by order. She leaves things on credit and collects weekly. She says that she loves to sell. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, and the items from catalogs come to her house.

She is going to use this loan to buy wallets, clothing, perfumes, jewelry, creams, cosmetics, and other products. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles, and she like it because of the help that the institution gives her. Her dreams are to be able to obtain a professional certificate, since she hopes to begin studying this year.

loans.use: Buy wallets, clothing, perfumes, jewelry, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Martha Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 12 y 7 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en  escuela. El marido trabaja en el mercado de Portoviejo.
 
Tiene un negocio en su casa en donde vende sodas, helados de la marca Topsy. Los días domingos prepara comida para vender. También se dedica a la cría de patos el mismo que cuando están grandes los vende a personas que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos, trabaja todos los días desde las 08 h 00 hasta las 16 h 00. Los helados y las sodas las recibe en su local, nos cuenta que ya son dos años que tiene su negocio y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar helados y sodas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio progresando dia a dia.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Cristo Resucitado [Risen Christ] meet in the Libertad #2 neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

In this place we find Martha, who is 30 years old, married, and has two daughters who are 7 and 12 years old.  They both attend school.  Her husband works in the market in Portoviejo.

She has a business in her home where she sells soda and Topsy ice cream.  On Sunday, she prepares the food to sell.  She also raises ducks, which she sells to people who come to her home to buy her animals.  She works every day from 8:00am until 4:00pm.  She receives the soda and ice creams at her store.  She has had her store for two years, and it has been going well.

This loan is to purchase ice creams and sodas.  She has been in the community bank for two cycles and she likes it because the interest is low and the institution provides many benefits.  Her dream is to continue improving her business every day.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream and soda
